title: This is nice!
text: I am not a poker player but this is a nice set!  I ordered it as a Christmas gift for my son and I am sure he will love it.  The quality of the chips is great and the case is very sturdy and lockable.  The case is very heavy as expected given the quantity and quality of the poker chips.  I just love this set and very happy with it.

title: Just ok.
text: I have seen a lot of these little busy boards and this one is just ok.  The material seems a little cheap.  I like giving these not just as a gift for little ones learning how to tie shoes, snap snaps, understand velcro but also as an item that parents keep as a memory keepsake. I have seen ones that seem like an heirloom.  This one doesn't feel like that.  I still love the idea though.

title: More fun!
text: Everybody gathered around Jacob's puzzle, watching him find all the animals.  This puzzle was great - easy for Jacob with some help from well-meaning relatives at a party.  Very colorful and the pieces are large enough to keep track of.  Jacob loves it and puts it together - repeating to see if he can do it faster each time!  Good choice for a gift.

title: It's really fun - and useful!
text: Jacob loves it.  While Mom is planting bulbs, Jacob's digging up the soil in the flower beds!  Probably not meant for manual labor, this is just a fun game with lots of parent interaction.  So far, the digger crane has held up well, and shows no signs of not living up to the task.  We're pleased with this fun toy/tool!

title: Jacob approved!
text: This was Jacob's introduction to puzzles of this kind, and he really liked it.  He like the subject matter, and he liked the large pieces that he could fit with others.  Looks like he'll be ready for more difficulty soon, as he mastered this one fairly soon - he's going on 4 years old.

title: Perfect!
text: Everybody's getting in the act to make this a beautiful Halloween House!  Jacob and Charlie think it's fantastic and love playing hide and seek with it!  It was easy to set up, and seems very sturdy and up to lasting through some tough little boys' rough and tumble!  Very pleased to see them having fun with their little house!  Great choice!

title: For the inquisitive child!
text: Once Jacob, 3 going on 4, got the hang of this, he was analyzing almost everything - and amazed at what he saw.  This really got his imagination going, and we could hardly keep up with what he wanted to magnify.  It will be interesting to see if he progresses to a more advanced model, as this has really captured his interest.  Good choice!

title: For the home gym
text: My granddaughter uses the home gym a lot, and likes to have some variety of equipment - so using this hoop became one of her favorite exercises.  She really likes it - takes it out on the deck to exercise in the fresh, cool air. It sees a lot of use!

title: Lots of fun!
text: What we like is that the whole family gets involved in great fun.  We had all ages getting in on the action.  Great gift for grandchildren.  Very sturdy - non-slip, and sure to last for hours of family fun.  Good choice!

title: Great idea!
text: So nicely packaged - great for gifting - and, best of all, each puzzle is beautiful and only 300 pieces.  We have lots of puzzles, but they usually get started with enthusiasm, and totally abandoned within a week!  These are just what they say - nice, calm puzzles, where folks can take some quiet time to relax doing something pleasant!  What a great idea!  Really look nice on the shelf, too!

title: The 4th of July hit!
text: We went to the river, where we played in a great lagoon, and this game kept the young ones busy for hours.  All ages, that ball just sticks to the paddle so it's easy to catch.  It hit the water a couple of times, but that didn't ruin the action.  Comes with 3 balls and 6 paddles, so lots can get in on the action.  Really a good choice to keep everyone busy having fun!

title: Not just for trampolines!
text: This works well about our large baby pool which we use to keep the alpacas cool.  They love the gentle spray.  Before we passed it to the alpacas the grandchildren enjoyed the cool experience just creating a water park on the lawn.  What's best is that this is sturdy but lightweight to set up.  When we have a trampoline, this will be great!  Good choice!

title: A brain test!
text: Everybody said nobody would want to work on this as I set it up on a table over the 4th! We had 15 family here for the holiday, and this puzzle got a work-out.  Never got it completely together, but everybody had a lot of fun trying.  Seems like everybody found a pice or two!  Really a colorful puzzle - and it's wood, so it's going to last.  Love the box it came in, too!

title: Kept them busy!
text: These were popular with grandchildren 6-10, and kept them occupied for a good long time.  No missing parts, everything went together easily, and it took some time to get the dinosaurs assembled.  Good tools included.  Would be a good gift for grandchildren in this age range.

title: Great for the pool!
text: These aren't for river tubing, but they are great for the pool.  So colorful, easy to inflate, put up with rough play - they're just what we needed for the grandkids.  When not in use, they just look pretty floating in the pool!

title: Really works well!
text: We have alpacas that we need to keep cool in our hot summer.  It's important to cool them from bottom up rather than top down, so the spray coming from this pool is ideal and they love it!.  We've had to patch one leak so far, but the patch has held, and we're still in business!  They suggest that if a dog plays in it, their nails need trimming beforehand.  Our dog got in it, so we know!  Great for alpacas and little kids, too.

title: Perfect for family times!
text: With a house-full planned for July 4th, it was great to find this game that can be played by all ages - everybody gets to play and participate, and we'll learn things about each other we did not know!  Great choice - easy to play!

title: A necessity!
text: We are balloon people - have to have them for all occasions.  It's too much to buy them inflated all the time, so we got a big supply of balloons and now we're ready for the next occasion!  Easy to use, inflates quickly.  Great idea!

title: Jacob approved
text: Jacob loves this book - a gift from great-grandma.  After having it read to him, he now reads it to us.  He loves the activities - and I like the parent-child interaction.  We've been happy with so many of Melissa and Doug's games for kids.

title: Terrific teaching aid!
text: My granddaughter is studying for her teaching credential for elementary students, so this package was a perfect resource for much she is doing.  It gave her a wide range of creative ideas for first grade children - and a chance to try some things out on  nephews and nieces!  Good choice!

title: Jacob approved!
text: This is a great building project, as it arrives with everything you need to build a truck.  Jacob was totally absorbed, as his Mom is an accomplished DIY person, so Jacob has seen the tools and knows when it's all together, it will be something special.  This is a great toy that will occupy hours of time, taking it apart and putting it back together!!

title: Children love these!
text: Jacob was busy for two hours straight right after these puzzles arrived.  With some explanation from Mom, he was off and running. These are really a fun challenge for him at four years old and he can't wait to play with them every day.  His Mom is a teacher, and she appreciates finding something that teaches - and grabs his attention and holds it.  Great choice for a gift.

title: Charlie approved!
text: Charlie has a “big boy” bike now and can ride with big brother Jacob!  This is just the right size for Charlie who is just getting his “sea legs” and will benefit greatly from this fun way to gain balance.  Really well-made to last and pass down.  Very sturdy and reliable to hold on to.  Easy for charlie to maneuver.  Everybody gives this 5 stars!

title: The grandchildren love this!
text: It's the size of it that they love, and that it can be enjoyed by 1 or 4-5 at the same time.  We've had so many storms that we have taken it down , which was easy - to be re-installed when the weather cooperates.  What a great idea - the kids (twins) found that they could both lie down while they swing - it captivates them for hours!  Good idea!

title: We like Montessori
text: This makes the job of introducing numbers to toddlers really easy and fun.  Jacob loves to play this “game” and learns so much at the same time.  Very sturdy play materials - made to last.  We like everything Montessori!

title: Great toy!
text: Very  sturdy wooden blocks which kids have a great time playing with - there are enough to make a walled fort, a tower, a fenced-off pasture for animals - no limits to the imagination!  Thank goodness there is a nice bag to keep them together and clean until the next time.  Nice to find playthings that will last - no batteries or plastic to break!

title: Jacob approved!
text: Lots of good activities in this Montessori toy set.  Jacob loves the fishing game especially.  Jacob is lucky to have a Mom who works with him on the activities - and she especially likes everything Montessori.  Jacob is having fun and learning something at the same time.

title: Complete kit
text: All ready to paint!  This kit contains a canvas, brushes and all the paint to complete a paint by number Van Gogh masterpiece.  Getting started is the problem.  We have an easel which sets up on the floor or on a table, and everything we need to get the new hobby going.  Over the upcoming holiday, we hope for action!  We're happy with the kit - just need to use it!

title: Jacob approves!
text: One thinks twice about adding a drum set to the musical instrument array, but this drum set may be a compromise. They really encouraged Jacob to listen to the music and determine the beat before just making noise.  He is in love with music, so this is a new favorite of his, and he does understand (at four years old) that he can add to the music and make it sound even better.  Great choice if you are considering a drum set.

title: Objective to capture a kids attention met!
text: This little game has really captured my grandson's attention! The directions are all in Chinese, so we just made up a way to play, but he's so into it. Fun colors and nice quality.

title: Fun to set up...
text: All really great quality play equipment - which gives assurance that it is sturdy and safe.  We're in the process of setting it up for a visit from grandchildren, and boy, will they be surprised!  There is so much to do.  We have an ideal large lawn area between two mature trees that will give them the whole experience.  Again, the materials are all impressively strong.  Very impressed with this special experience for our grandchildren.

title: Jacob loves it!
text: As soon as this was unpacked and set up, Jacob had the magnetic ruler and was drawing lines!  He kept saying, “I love this fing for my art.”  Jacob is three going on four.  His Mom is a teacher, so she was thrilled to have such a useful tool she can use in getting Jacob ready for school next year.  This is one of the best easels we've seen as far as all it offers - the paper roll is really great - and the 3 in 1 offers so much to keep Jacob busy. It's well-constructed and sturdy, too. Great choice!

title: Cute!
text: This is a very cute knitted sloth for the person who is all about sloths!  Kids love these - and adults love the lavender sachet inside, which can add warmth.  This is well-made.  The description of “plush pal” may be somewhat deceptive - the body is very smooth plush and the head and extremities are knitted.  Nice face!

title: Jacob loves it!
text: This “busy board” really keeps Jacob (2+) busy.  Lots of interesting challenges, and something he can work on alone or with Mom.  Nicely made to last.  Great learning experiences - nice from Montessori for the young ones.

title: Arrived for Father's Day!
text: Father and son sure had a ball with this - very hot day, and they loved the nice, cool water slide to have fun outside!  Easy to set up, and very durable - nice slippery surface.  Three year old Jacob was a bit concerned at first, but it took no time for him to join in the fun when he saw BOTH  Mom and Dad got involved!  Great waterslide - and best of all, it gets the family together!

title: Great activity during the quarantine!
text: The twin grandchildren loved this, and, best of all, it's a continuing activity as things are discovered that they want  “on the wall”.  So far, there is great competition (9 years old) to see who can find the funniest saying to put up, the craziest picture - well, you can see that they've created a game around this wall collage.  Great choice - the parents are getting involved, too.

title: Family fun...
text: This is one way to get everybody engaged...we've assembled a lot of games for the time that we can have visitors again - we've read the instructions and read a number of the cards, and can see that it will be very interesting and it can involve all ages.  Good choice!

title: Love these big dice!
text: Really well-made and interesting. It's all set up to get us going - scorecards, game instructions, etc.  The dice are beautiful!  Really works of art. So if the game loses its luster, they will always be great decor items!  We put them and everything for a game in a basket, so it's already a conversation piece.  Folks are intrigued by the size of the dice!  Fun game for a gift.

title: Super comfortable!
text: How do I know?  We took it out of the box and blew it up - and tried it out on the family room floor!  If it's anywhere near as comfortable in the water as it was on the hard floor, it's a total winner, and the family will be drawing straws to see whose turn it is to use it!  It looks great - nice colors - was easy to inflate and deflate - and we absolutely can't wait to try it out at the lake.  It's made of strong material, and looks like it will be around for many summers!  So comfortable!

title: Jacob's best birthday gift!
text: This is a great bubble blower - it comes with the bubble solution - and kids have more fun with this.  Easy for young kids to use - and it's a great birthday present.  After Jacob got this going, he didn't have time for his other presents.  Easy, safe fun for the whole family.  Good choice!

title: The perfect “toy”at the perfect time...
text: Jacob is a little young for this, but he thoroughly enjoyed playing with this because Dad played with him.  Both were waiting for a baby brother to be born, so the timing was perfect!  Jacob is mature for his age, so he knew about dinosaurs, but this was a chance to get really involved with them.  Dad made it come alive, so time sped by.  Now, this is something that Jacob brings out when Mom is busy with the new baby.  Couldn't  have found a better kit for Jacob - now he's all about dinosaurs!

title: An Easter hit!
text: Arrived just in time for Easter fun.  Jacob was getting used to having a baby brother, and he and Dad made some great music with these great shaker Easter eggs - which Dad hid afterward.  They had a great time with this.  Nice to have this diversion from all the other excitement.  Good choice!

title: Jacob approved...
text: This arrived with perfect timing, as Mom was just bringing Jacob's baby brother home from the hospital. Jacob was able to meet his brother, and then, with some help, get deeply involved in this pegboard game.  His aunt worked with him - it gave Mom a chance to get baby settled and put her feet up, too.  Jacob loved everything he could do with this - it's been set up on the dining room table since it arrived, so he spends time with it everyday.  Great choice!

title: Fantastic kite!
text: What could be better than a kite shaped like a super-sonic airplane - we can't wait to see this in the air!  It was easy to put together, and now it sits waiting for the rain to stop and the return of the sun and thermals that will let it fly high!  Our grandson, Mason, will love this kite, and flying kites with grandchildren is one of our most fun things to do.  Up to now, our kites have been pretty bland, so we can't wait for the good weather to launch this beauty!

title: Rain, rain, go away!
text: This kite is fabulous!  The details are wonderful - and the instructions for putting it together are so easy.  We can't wait for a sunny day to fly it!  We have great thermals and breezes which will carry the kite so high!  Great kite!

title: Perfect for Jacob..
text: Dad's in the Navy, so he could explain what an astronaut does - and Jacob and Dad watch space shuttle launches together.  Jacob now will tell you what his astronaut does, and when he disappears, he's gone to the space station!  Good play with Dad.  The astronaut is well-made and has a nice space suit on.  Jacob really likes him!

title: Really cute!
text: This time, the birthday gift is for an adult who owns a bull terrier - and this is a dead ringer, right down to the black spots on the nose!  Could not pass this up, as how often do you see a bull terrier plush toy?  Never!!  This is a very sweet plush animal, and sure to be passed on to the birthday boy's son!  Well-made, quality toy - and,oh, so soft!

title: Jacob loves this!
text: This play tent and crawl tunnel is a gift to an expectant Mom, who is contending with an active toddler  as she prepares for the new baby!  Jacob loves this - it offers him so many different activities.  His dog can enjoy the tunnel with him, which we need to take pictures of!  This is so easy to assemble, Jacob helped, and it is sturdy for rough play.  All you need for this is some space, which Jacob has - so it's quickly become a favorite!  Great choice for a toddler - great choice for a gift!

title: Christmas in July!
text: Nothing like planning ahead!  My first train was a Lionel, and we bought a Lionel train when the kids were growing up.  My grandchildren don't have a train, so there should be one at Grandma's house!  We had so much fun setting this up - it worked perfectly, and I didn't want to put it back in the box until Christmas.  So, we've decided on Christmas in July, when the kids will be with us, and can really spend some time getting to know and have fun with a train.  My uncle had a Lionel that ran all over his house, and I'm not anticipating that, but we'll see if anybody catches the “train bug” which would make adding more track, etc., a necessity.  Great fun - great train!

title: More fun - adults and kids!
text: We asked - what's more fun, the bumping or rolling around in the ball?  The kids decided that both were fun, because they loved bumping their parents and watching them roll around!  Thank goodness for lots of lawn space, and two of these - this can keep some kids busy for the better part of an afternoon - especially if the parents get involved. The balls are easy to inflate with our compressor, and easy to deflate when the kids' visit is over.  Love these balls - everybody has fun - rolling around or just watching!

title: Jacob loves them!
text: Jacob, almost 3, loves all musical instruments.  He says they are like what the teacher has at pre-school, so he launched into a musical treat for all of us.  What a collection - this kept Jacob fascinated for hours, as he has only played the triangle at pre-school.  I'm not sure the parents are always glad when you bring gifts like this (noisy), but Jacob was thrilled.  He calls and plays them for us now!  Love that he loves them!

title: Beautiful to see!
text: We love having a nice, open area which is perfect for kite flying.  This is a beautiful kite, and with our breezes and thermals, was easy to launch and fly.  The tails look so pretty when the kite is aloft.  This is a large kite, and will need adult supervision - but that's what we hope for - getting parents and kids involved.  The kids plan to bring a kite next time they come - and this one will be waiting  to join them.  It's still in good shape despite a couple of near crashes.

title: Kids sure love these!
text: We didn't have to give our 9 year old grandchildren many instructions for these bumper soccer balls - they were off and away in no time, having a great time!  We  have a large lawn area, which was perfect for getting the most out of these.  We always try to have some new experience when the kids come and this was a winner - with Dads and uncles around, everybody ended up in the act!  We love things that will be memorable for the kids - and fun with the bubble balls surely will be!

title: How to get them off the couch!
text: These aren't just for kids!  These are really fun when the whole family gets involved!  The kids love to see Uncle Charlie take giant steps and do the crab walk!  Very imaginative and loaded with laughs!  Even the most dedicated couch potato will play and follow what the dice say!  It's produced some really unforgettable times for us.  Always looking for things that get the whole family together!

title: Jacob wants to be a super hero
text: Jacob loves his costume - we had to make some adjustments because it was big for him, but that's good because it will last longer.  Jacob's superhero saves puppies - he owns a Australian Shepherd, and it is getting used to being saved!  The costume is well-made - it comes with all kinds of party supplies, so you can bet that Jacob's next birthday will have a superhero theme!  Good  choice!

title: Jacob loves super heroes...
text: Not the kind of superheroes that shoot'em up - more the kind that save puppies and people.  So this superhero goes where Jacob goes - including to bed at night.  Had to get a super hero outfit for Jacob so he can join his friend! Jacob (2 1/2)  loves this super hero toy!  Nicely made - great costume - good choice!

title: Every grandchild needs a teepee!
text: We love to surprise Jacob with items that will give him a fun experience and lend itself to interaction with parents.  Jacob loves having a place that it all his own, for privacy, for naps and it's just a great place to hide, too.  It was fun putting it up - easier than expected - and Jacob was so thrilled when he saw it!  It's big enough that friends can get in there with him - and sometimes you just need to “camp out” in the living room!!  Great choice - Jacob, loves it.  It's sturdy, and once up, it withstands  all the good play!

title: Perfect little mousy girl!
text: Baby's first doll - this one is perfect -sewn on eyes and nose for safety!  Clothes are sewn on, too, so no lost clothes!  Bound to be a favorite for any years - very colorful and smiley!  We like to give these at baby showers as everyone likes them and the new mother loves them.  Great choice!

title: We love these dolls!
text: This a cute kitty girl with pretty clothes, and sewn on eyes and nose for safety. Perfect first doll for baby.  This is our favorite baby gift at baby showers and it always gets ooohs and ahs!  Moms know that this doll will be loved!  Good choice!

title: We love these dolls!
text: Wonderful idea - just a cuddly, sweet bunny doll - with the clothes sewn on and eyes and nose sewn on as well for perfect safety!  No expensive clothes or toys to buy, just a really cute bunny girl who makes you smile!  Whoever came up with these, should win an award!  Perfect first doll for a baby. - and her older sister, as well!

title: So cute and different!
text: It's difficult to find new dolls that will appeal without a raft of expensive clothes,, cosmetics, houses, cars, etc.!  These are just very sweet, and put the imagination to work - which is a healthy thing to do!  Soft and scrunchy and so huggable!  Clothes are sewed on, so all the doll is asking for is love!  Love these dolls, and we know two little girls who will love them, too!

title: Jacob! wants to be a fireman
text: Unfortunately, this fireman outfit is a bit big for him right now, but at the rate he's growing, it'll fit in no time!  He's thrilled with the hat and the jacket with reflective stripes.  This costume is really well  made and will let Jacob be a fireman for  at least a couple of Halloweens!  He loves this - and we love making him happy!

title: Fun parent-child activity!
text: Children are always fascinated with cameras and this one is a great place to start.  It looks like a real camera and it works like one, too.  Lots of “pictures” to look at - perfect for the 2-3 year old, before they're ready for the real thing.  Great birthday gift, too.  Very colorful and fun.

title: Very well-made - not costume quality
text: Danny's girls are just the right ages to begin reading about the little house on the prairie, so this dress is absolutely perfect to role play and play pretend games.  This dress comes with an apron and a darling bonnet - just the kind of dress Laura would wear!  The dress is trimmed with white lace, too.  This dress may be handed down over the years - it's that nice.  Very happy with this dress.

title: For trips to the lake...
text: The kids have a floating “island”, but as the Grandma of the family, I need my own float.  This one is perfect - a lounge chair!  There's a rather unique way to fill it with air, involving opening it up and running to fill it with air, so we'll let the grandchildren have that fun!  Looking forward to summer!

title: Summer camp at the farm.
text: We like to have lots of things for the grandkids to do - and nothing takes the place of a whole bunch of balls and everything you can do with them.  This is a great selection of balls for all purposes.  The kids love to kick the balls across the pasture in the wide open spaces.  For kids who live in crowded communities, we love to see them taking advantages of all the space to run and have fun.  Great addition to our collection!  Includes a pump - kids like to do that, too!

title: Very necessary baseplate for Legos...
text: Without this baseplate, the grandkids would put something together only to have it fall apart as a dog walked by - thus the need for a base upon which to build.  Anchored to the baseplate, the creations stay put and are preserved for their next visit.  I just wish the baseplate was about four times bigger.  The grandkids are old enough to take on bigger and better kits that require much more base space.  I'll be looking for a larger one, or ordering a couple more.

title: So cute and he sings a song!
text: “If you're happy and you know it, clap your hands” - and he goes “clap-clap”!  Almost all the little kids know that song, so they love to have a monkey to sing it with! This monkey is soft and lovable, and will be a best buddy for any boy or girl.  We picked it for Jacob, who loves to sing!  Gund makes beautiful, quality toys, and this one is a perfect example.  Very pleased to gift this to 3 year old Jacob, who will love him!

title: Dinosaurs live at Grandma's house!
text: I love having these fine representations of animals the children favor - we have two other sets of Battat animals which the children love to play with when they visit.  The animals are beautifully painted and formed.  They are great for imaginative play - and also for collections.

title: Grandchildren approved!
text:
This was the hit at Thanksgiving for the 9 year old grandchildren - and it gave the parents a chance to introduce the kids to PAC-Man. Brought back some memories for them! Good interaction between the kids and Dad.
.

title: Perfect new baby gift!
text: Give a gift that lasts, and can be enjoyed by parents and baby!  Cute, tiny colorful books  that will get baby's attention!

title: Great baby gift!
text: Parents and babies love these.  They're well-made to last - colorful and fun for baby and parents.

title: Jacob loves these!
text: This is a great “game” to play with Mommy or Daddy or both - Jacob loves the different faces!  Great idea - Jacob is almost three, and he really loves to play with this book, and surprise his parents with the different faces.

title: Children love this!
text: Children love this as well as Star Wars fans - and it keeps them busy working together for hours!  I like that it brings parents and children together. The finished starship is a collectible - or it can be part of Star Wars play for a long time.  This is a good LEGO building kit that shows progress quickly.  God choice!

title: Gift for a jokester!
text: This was a gift for the family jokester, which went over well.  We didn't dare give it to the younger grandchild for fear that it would show up at school.  We all good a good laugh with this toy!

title: Never too old for a big, warm tiger!
text: Our grandchildren surprise us often with what they like and what they wish for.  As a pillow on the bed or on the floor, this well-made tiger is the perfect cuddle-buddy!  Nothing like curling up with a tiger on the floor to watch TV!  The workmanship is great, and the quality is obvious.  Another hit from Melissa and Doug...

title: Very realistic!
text: For our little dirt mover, Jacob, 3, this bulldozer was loved at first site.  Fortunately, we saw Jacob before the ground froze, so he had a great time excavating and making piles in our empty flower beds!  For the child who thrives on heavy equipment and loves to get dirty - and a mother who doesn't mind cleaning him up, this is the perfect toy!

title: For our treasury of games!
text: In our quest to give the grandchildren more to do than their devices offer, we have a trunk of table games - the good old favorites that nobody knows how to play anymore.  Dominoes is one of their favorites, and got a lot of play over Thanksgiving.  We appreciate the wood storage box, as, so far, putting the tiles away is part of the game!  High quality set from Melissa and Doug - very pleased with this game.

title: Good gift for an 8 year old...
text: My granddaughter, 8, liked the idea of writing a summary of her last visit with us - and she plans to bring it with her for the future visits.  It's interesting to read her “take” on things.  If this gets her started on writing, it will be a great gift - so far, she's really enjoying it, and reading her “reports”.  This is a good diversion from the tablets and cell phones!

title: Everything old is new again!
text: It doesn't happen over night, with some adult participation, our grandchildren are learning to play checkers and backgammon.  They love checkers - not so much backgammon.  These Melissa and Doug wooden game boards are not only great to look at, they're fun to play on - colorful and sturdy.  We're winning the war against noses buried in devices little by little, thanks to these quality game boards!

title: I'm going to get another one!
text: This was something I had for my grandson (8) on his last visit.  He grabbed it and put it in his suitcase to take home.  That's the first time that's happened.  He told me he would have better luck opening it at home away from his twin sister!  So, I don't know what was inside - he is very happy with it, and that's all this grandma wants!

title: Imaginative play!
text: These  are really good representations of the real thing - my grandchildren love the bear family, and have great fun playing imagination games.  When we can take the animals outside, we make a house for them.  They are one thing that gets them away from the TV!

title: Great holiday gift!
text: This is the perfect holiday activity for our 8 years old twins - there will be help from older cousins if they need it.  So, with rain predicted for Thanksgiving, we have a great indoor activity planned.  This is a particularly nice building kit - we had to try out a part of out ourselves and almost got hooked completely!  They love LEGO building kits - and this one is going to be a special favorite!  Quality parts and pieces go together easily.

title: For the animal lover!
text: My granddaughter is the animal lover, so this LEGO set was perfect for her.  She really got into the “Rescue Mission” aspect of this LEGO set - and spent hours playing with it after she had it all set up.  This was a great departure from building towns and buildings with thousands of pieces.  This was manageable and she was able to put it together in an hour or so,  This set seemed to have m ore appeal to girls, too  - I can't always get Mia interested in building the Empire State Building!  The pieces all fit easily and nothing was missing.  Very happy with this set.

title: Perfect father-son activity.
text: This was a perfect birthday present for my grandson, who loves all Legos.  This was perfect because it combines Batman with Legos - and it was a joy to see him sit down with this right away and go to work.  An hour or so later, he was showing everybody his “Batcycle”.  He did have some help from his Dad - and that's another reason to  give LEGO sets - it's something father and son can do together.  The pieces were well made and fit together easily, and produced a satisfying result!  Very pleased.

title: Very cute and fun to play with!
text: I think this is just the beginning of a collection - this is too cute and the clothes are great!  My 8 year old granddaughter will love this - can't wait for her to see it on Thanksgiving.  Grandma always tries to have something new and special when my grandchildren visit and this is a keeper!  I'd like to play with it myself!

title: The grandchildren will love it!
text: We opened this and played it ourselves before the grandchildren get ahold of it at Thanksgiving.  We had a ball with it, so we know they will, too.  Takes some practice to be good at it - but they'll catch on quickly.  Great choice!

title: One of the perfect classic games...
text: We are fortunate to have a game area, with a table perfect for Pick-up Sticks.  It was always a favorite when we visited my grandmother, so it was great to see that it is still in existence.  And, it's well-made and still a lot of fun to play!  Good choice!

title: More fun!
text: Our granddaughter loves this set - it allows her to get really creative with her nails - which is all the thing these days.  In a salon. It costs a lot to get some of these same effects, so this is a money-saver, too!  On a rainy afternoon, this was an all afternoon activity and everybody had fun.  Guess we'll have to add it to Spa Night!

title: The grandkids loved it!
text: We have lots of open hardwood floor space, so this was fun for the older grandchildren, playing with the younger ones.  Wish we had taken pictures!  Everybody loved the super huge puzzle - it went together quickly, and then it was fun to sit on and see all the animals!  Good choice!

title: Grandma collects animals!
text: This is part of Grandma's pet project - stirring the grandkids imaginations.  So, I'm collecting animals - not just any - but these Terra animals which are so realistic and well-made.  We have a wonderful place to play in the dirt, and that's where we're building our jungle!  Gotta get those kids away from their cell phones!  So far, my jungle plan is capturing their imaginations!  Mostly due to these really great, realistic animals.

title: Time for traditional games!
text: The grandchildren that visit were the right age to learn some of the traditional board games, so these Melissa and Doug games really fill the bill.  They're well-made and very colorful.  The games do hold the kids attention- particularly the Chinese Checkers.  I love that they are so attractive - when the kids lose interest, these can hang on the wall!  Great choice!

title: For kids who love Sponge Bob!
text: This is perfect for the little guys who love to make funny, sometimes, disgusting sounds.  We've had to tell him it never goes to school - so he just drives us crazy with it at home!  He loves to watch Sponge Bob on TV, so he is a big fan!  Great choice for some fun!

title: “Fly, fly” - this 2 year old was expecting action!  Very realistic and pretty.
text: When 2 year old Cora got this unicorn, she knocked it over, climbed on it and said “fly, fly”!  It was meant as decor for her new “big girl” room, but she was looking for action!  After some help from Mom, she understood and was content to comb his mane and talk to him.  She may be a bit young for this, but it's definitely growing on her, with help from her older sister!

title: Not a winner this time!
text: I thought my 8 year old granddaughter would have a ball with this, but she played with it for a while, and then never returned to it.  The true test is if she asks to take a toy home. But she didn't.  I realize all kids don't like all toys, but she usually plays a lot of imaginative games so I was surprised that she wouldn't make more of this cute baby tiger.

title: Good for hours of fun!
text: The grandkids had a great time with this when they visited last weekend.  It's a bit difficult to find things to keep these 8 year olds busy and happy - but this captured their imaginations.  We were their audience, and were impressed with their creations!  Good choice!

title: Jacob wanted to wear it to bed!
text: Jacob - 2 1/2, loves his tool belt!  He's ready to fix almost everything, and wanted to wear it to bed!  Dad's got one, too, so, Jacob knows exactly what to do with each tool!  Great toy for an industrious little guy - and a winner for grandma!

title: More fun for the grandchildren on the farm!
text: My grandchildren had a great time painting butterflies during their last visit.  Everything we needed was included, and the results were very colorful.  These Melissa and Doug crafts are always well put together and meaningful.  Everybody had a butterfly to take home - just wish I'd gotten a picture of the finished projects!  I'll be looking for more crafts like this.

title: Perfect for a wedding!
text: We're into lots of celebrations, so balloons are a necessity.  These will be perfect for an upcoming wedding planned for around Christmas time - white balloons, snow - it will be perfect.  These are very sturdy balloons and having 100 of them will make quite a showing.  Great choice!

title: Great fun at Grandma's house!
text: E had a great time with the super big bubbles over 4th of July!  No fireworks allowed in our fire country, so this was the highlight for the younger kids.  We made the bubble mixture, which worked great, and were amazed at how large the bubbles got - and, how long they lasted.  We have a horse farm next door, and I was afraid we would freak out the horses - the pine trees popped them!  Good fun when the kids visit!

title: Fun and a learning experience!
text: Our granddaughter had a great time with this over 4th of July - next time, we'd do it outside, though as the mixture of fragrances is a bit much for everybody else.  Great “science kit” though, and she learned a bit about fragrances.  She left smelling like everything she was playing with, so her Mom said, “Thanks a lot!”

title: Very cute “fuzzimals”!
text: We made Fuzzimals over the 4th of July  weekend and the kids loved it - and the results.  Both made really cute “fuzzimals” which they took home with them.  Lots of fun making them - all the cousins got involved - which we love to see.  Very pleased with this activity. Kept the kids away from the TV and tablets for a good while!

title: Easy to learn and play - lots of laughs!
text: We had our first chance to play this game as a group when he had a big gang here for July 4th.  Even those who don't like games had fun playing this!  Lots of laughs and promises to play again next time there's a visit!  Can't ask more of a game than that!

title: Fun and Educational!
text: This was a special treat for my granddaughter (8) - we built the house, and added the caterpillars.  Our visit came to an end at this point, but, thankfully, she was back just as the caterpillars were turning into beautiful butterflies!  At the end of her three day visit, we released them in the garden and watched them fly away.  Really a fun and educational experience!

title: Good for imaginative play!
text: These are really good animal figures - lots of detail and sturdy enough for rough play.  My grandchildren have fun playing with them outside, building corrals for them - pretending they're real.  I'm always on the lookout for things of interest that lures them away from the TV and tablets, and these do the trick.  When they're older, these will be collectibles.

title: Great horse figures for imaginative play!
text: We live on a farm next to a horse farm, so when the grandkids visit, the horses are always a curiosity.  Call me naive, but I thought if we have these really great horse figures, that they might actually go out in the grass and dirt, and have some pretend games with the horses.  And, that's what they did!  No “Grandma, can I play with your  IPad?”  Just good, dirty, imaginative play.  Miracle!  I love these figures - they're well-made, nicely detailed, and built to last!  At last, a great idea!

title: Perfect for my granddaughter!
text: This is the cutest doll I've ever seen, and so perfect for my Asian granddaughter.  She'll love her hair and her outfit!  One thing I don't understand is why the Adora dolls' eyes don't close and open.  The faces are always so beautiful, but the eyes don't close.  This is a very high quality doll - the clothing is well-made, and the face and body are perfect.  She will love it!

title: Adult participation required!
text: This is a Lego building kit that needs a lot of adult participation.  I didn't realize the impact of a kit with 2500+ pieces until I saw the look on my daughter-in-law's face.  For our 8 year old twin grandchildren, this was too much, and we agreed to keep this kit at grandma's to work on during visits.  It's a great kit, and once we get it all together, we'll have to find a permanent place for it!  Right now, every guest we have works on it a bit - good thing we've got a table where they can work on it! Great LEGO quality.

title: Grandchildren love this building kit!
text: My 8 year old twin grandchildren loved building this on their visit to see our new farm - their first visit.  What could be more appropriate than this LEGO kit - a great intro to what we plan to plant, how we'll harvest it, etc.  This was a great choice for a fun occasion.  They love LEGO building kits.

title: Quality - tiny, for tiny hands!
text: I've got to read the fine print!  I thought this engine would be much bigger!  But, as it turned out, it was perfect for Jacob's little hands, and he thought it was the nuts!  He (2 1/2) loves everything Thomas, so this just fit in with many other toys he has.  It is so well made - you can easily see the quality.  Grandma got five stars for this toy.

title: Fun at Grandma's with LEGO and a movie!
text: We paired the kit with watching a Star Wars movie - so building a Sith Droid Gunship made sense!  My grandson loved it.  There's always fun at grandma's house!  Thank you, Lego!

title: Good fun for all ages!
text: A perfect toy for my grandson now that we live in the wide open spaces.  This goes like a bomb and we used to have to go to the school parking lot on weekends to give this a work out.  Now, we have miles of isolated country roads, so my grandson and the one visiting this weekend, are going to have a ball.  Both grandsons - one's 36 and the other is 8.  Great for something the cousins to do together!

title: Everybody loved working on San Francisco!
text: In our new home, we finally have the space for a “game room” - and a large table to allow for these great LEGO kits.  What this grandma likes best is seeing parents and children working together on projects like this.  San Francisco was a favorite with everyone.  Brought back great memories of our last trip there!

title: Strong materials, larger size!
text: We have moved to a cooler climate, so we won't be using this pool any day soon - but summer is coming!  We like it because it has higher sides, and it is made of strong material, which will withstand a dog jumping in.  Hot summer days are ahead (we're hoping), and we'll be prepared.  This will do well out on the grass or on our large deck, and, checking the inner surface, it has a thicker surface than most.  Can't wait until we need it!

title: Perfect for little hands!
text: The perfect cars for little hands - and especially a fan of Thomas!  Little Jacob, 2, loves each and every one of the cars, and it makes this grandma happy to see him all wrapped up in a toy at my house!  Well-made, colorful and indestructible - very important!  Great choice!

title: Good for older/younger brother together....
text: This provided great activity for older and younger brother.  This car reaches a pretty high speed, so some adult supervision is necessary.  Everyone wants to play with this car, and finding a large place to let it go is best.  Very sturdy - when it plows into something at high speed, it can chip paint off a molding or wall.  From the description, I was expecting more of a truck - but this is definitely a race car.  Kids love it!

title: More fun at Christmas!
text: These were a total hit at Christmas time - with so many memories preserved - totally from a child's perspective.  Easy to use. The 8 year old twins picked up on the fun they could have with these and continue to capture what is important - and also funny - to them.  These were surpringly sturdy considering the way they were passed around, put down, picked up, etc.  Seems like they were in constant use.  Good choice!

title: Kids love this!
text: This was a hit at Grandma's house - the kids knew exactly what to do with it, and filmed some memorable sights!  Put a camcorder in the hands of kids, and you'll get it all - the good, the bad, the ugly - and the hilarious!  This was easy to operate and everybody had a ball with it.  Good choice for any event - great gift!

title: Great attention-holder!
text: I've never seen a toy that captured my grandchildren's interest and attention like these magnet sticks.  Amazing what they built - and when one “project' was completed, they were quick to start another.  Easy to store, easy to keep the parts together.  This was fun for the adults, too, when the kids gave us a chance!

title: Good quality toy for parent/child interaction.
text: This was the hit with the younger grandsons over the holidays - lots of play with the dinosaurs - transporting them all over the house.  We have a dinosaur book, so this was an excuse to sit down for some father/son interaction while they all got identified and read about.  Very happy with any toy that brings parents/children together.  This one is well-made - a good quality toy.

title: Nice big puppy for hours of fun!
text: Jacob loves this puppy!  Riding around on it is only half the fun. Rolls easily.  Jacob is 18 months old and this is just the right size for him.  It's sturdy, colorful and gives him much to laugh about.  Frankly, it's bigger than we expected, but that's turned out to be a plus.

title: Perfect game for the youngest ones!
text: This game is perfect for play with an adult - it doesn't take the young ones long to learn, and they're ready to play with other kids. What I liked was the opportunity for father-son or mother-daughter interaction - or older children-younger children.  Anything that will get everybody playing together is a winner for me.

title: Great-grandson loves them!
text: Anything with Thomas's name on it is a hit with my great-grandson.  He absolutely loves these cars, and it's comething Dad can play with him - talking about each truck, what out is and what it does.  These cars are perfect for little hands - they're easy to carry around and take along for a ride in the car.  A total hit!

title: Fun for all ages!
text: This game can get wild right down to the final minutes!  Fun for all ages - which is always something this grandma is looking for.  Lots of twists and turns - and sometimes things turn at the last minute.  Keeps the group together!  Watchers have fun, too!  Great fun for the family.

title: Fun - the carrying case is a plus!
text: Little smaller set than I expected, but still plenty of beads and charms, etc. to keep two little girls busy.  Grandma is always looking for something to keep my granddaughter busy and happy, especially when she brings a friend with her - so these craft kits fill the bill.  I especially like the carrying case, which makes it easy for her to take everything home with her.  These Petit Collage craft sets have good quality materials and ideas for what can be created.

title: A new raceway at grandma's!
text: As long as my grandson finds new ways to play with cars whenever he visits grandma's house, he'll be a race car fanatic!  This provides a different raceway for the mini racers - so is something that can be set up in a small space, and left up as long as interest lasts - which in his case, is a long time!  He loves that pinball effect, and the speed he can create.  He loves Disney Pixar cars and this new raceway!  Looks to be a sturdy toy - no problem setting it up - lots of fun for racers!

title: Creative, imaginative fun!
text: This really brings out the creativity and imagination.  We had a competition to see who could create the weirdest alien - which turned out pretty funny!  Great father/son activity - also grandma/grandchild.  The kids ask me to bring this out when they come to visit, so looks like grandma has a winner!  Lots of choices too work with.

title: No more serious pictures!
text: These are essential when the whole family gets together!  This grandma has given up trying to get a serious picture, but bring out the big glasses and other decor, and everybody lines up right away!  There's a lot to choose from - what they choose tells you something about their personalities...  The party's just more funny with crazy pictures - so this was a great choice to liven things up!

title: Fun for grandkids to make!
text: This is a fun project for a grandmother and grandkids.  Brings out their creativity, and you end up with something useful!  These are really cute and look very colorful on the tree.  And, they're a reminder of the fun we had making them!  Great idea.

title: Hours of father/son activity!
text: This became so appropriate when visiting Grandpa's ranch - building farm equipment just like what we're seeing in use!  This has kept father and son totally engaged - great activity for the whole family waiting and watching the finished product.  Really challenges and satisfies.

title: Every student should have a globe!
text: The grandkids are fascinated by this globe.  We talk about the various countries and find them on the globe.  Seeing the stars and constellations is a thrill, too.  Just one more curiosity at Grandma's house - they don't have a globe home.  They love the game of finding countries they've heard about.  Good learning activity.

title: Great idea to bring friends together!
text: This was perfect for a sleepover with all my granddaughter's  friends.  There's lots of materials to work with - lots of possibilities for necklaces and bracelets.  All the girls loved this and Grandma was a hero!

title: Easy to master - fun at Grandma's
text: This is perfect for 18 month old Jacob, who is learning about shapes.  It's amazing how quickly he mastered this.  Now it's a favorite toy at Grandma's house.

title: How to love bathtime!
text: Oh boy, is this fun in the bathtub!  If you have a child who doesn't want to take a bath - this fire truck is guaranteed to change all that!  More fun - just prepare to get wet!  No kidding - this is really fun - the little ones love it!

title: Perfect for all ages...
text: Fortunately, we live in a temperate climate, so this can remain outside under cover for lots of play.  This is enjoyed by all ages - which is what I'm always looking for - ways to get us all together.  This is good for Grandmas, too.  So, from the amount of play it's getting, I'd call this a winner!  Great idea, too.

title: Small, but lots of fun!
text: Suddenly, it's all the little things that are popular.  Always looking for something trendy for my granddaughter.  She loves Luna, and puts her through all her paces.  This was good for substantial play time, and was one of the toys at Grandma's house that she begged to take home!  That, alone, proves that it's a winner!

title: Perfect for an American Girl...
text: This  was the perfect accessory for my granddaughter's American Girl Doll. she loves kitties, but can't have one due to allergies, so this lets  her pretend that she and her “best friend” have a kitty!  She loves the carrying case and food dish, too.  Good choice!

title: Everybody loves it!
text: This is really a well-made, cute as a button tram for the critters!  The grown-ups can hardly keep their hands off - and, if your youngster is too young like my great grandson, you must supervise all play and watch out for the smaller pieces.  We keep threatening to put it away for a while, but, the little guys want to play with it and so do the Moms!  Very cute little critters!  Looks like it is sturdy enough to be around for a while!

title: Colorful and cute!
text: If you aren't an “Exploding Kittens” fan, it's difficult to explain this tacocat pillow.  It's colorful and well-stuffed - so for those who collect, this would be a worthy to the collection.

title: Great rainy day activity!
text: There are plenty of beads, so several kids can work with this at once.  My grandchildren started out with the templates, and then quickly branched out to get really creative.  It gets a bit messy with spraying the creations with water, but it only takes 10 minutes or so for them to adhere to each other.  Everybody had fun with these!

title: A winner!
text: This was a total hit with my young great grandson, who is hooked on Peppa Pig.  He played with this all during his visit, and he “wuved” it so much he had to take it home!  Usually toys stay at Grandma's, but I had to relent!  The camper is much larger than expected, and full of interesting things to see and do - including a slide into a pool.  We did have trouble with one camper door, which kept falling off, but that didn't interfere with the play.  Very cute - and Jacob loved it!

title: Perfect family activity!
text: Oh, what fun we all had putting this together!  My granddaughter and her friend, her aunt and me - all sitting around working and watching this quilt take shape!  Finished, it's quality fleece, soft and comfy!  Perfect activity - kinda like the good old days where ladies sat around quilting!  Great idea!

title: Great for almost any girl!
text: My granddaughter absolutely loves this!  Since she was sneaking Mom's makeup for herself (age 8), this gives her a free rein to experiment and create some of the pretty and sometimes crazy looks!  She spends a lot of time with this -  I thought it might be a focus for a short time, but she plays with this over and over.  Good choice!

title: Ample number of pets and paint!
text: This is loved by both my twin grandchildren - going on 8.  It's bringing out their creativity and artistic talent.  This is great as a gift for twins, as there's enough material for two children.  They love the finished products and so do we.  Lots of fun for all ages really.

title: Very popular with a granddaughter!
text: This is so cute, and my granddaughter couldn't wait to get started on it.  She's going on 8, so she and a friend had a great time with their creation!  We had to help some, but once they got the hang of “sewing”, it went fast.  Very popular crafty item!

title: A
text: For the beginning magician - this is a good array of fairly simple tricks.  Most of the basic tricks are included, and our grandson had his show ready rather quickly.  This is a good way to assess interest without spending a fortune - and after two weeks, he's still getting tricks ready when a friend is coming over.  So, this was a good choice for him.

title: Sturdy and very entertaining...
text: Our grandson loves everything Thomas, so this was an immediate hit.  He needed some help from Mom with the set up, but then was able to entertain himself for a good long time.  Thomas toys are well-made and sturdy, so don't fall apart frequently.  This one is still standing after two weeks of daily play.  Good choice!

title: Great idea!  Amazing toy!
text: This is like a Rubic's Cube for the toddler set!  Great-grandson absolutely loves this, and is getting the hang of getting it all back together.  Right now he's having just as much fun rolling around on the pieces as he is putting it together.  This has presented all kinds of possibilities for fun.  His Daddy has been deployed, but when he returns next month, he will be amazed at what his son can do - and there is bound Tom be competition in putting it together!  Great toy!  All soft foam pieces for the little guys!  Jacob has decided it's a fort, too, and a great way to keep the dog away!

title: It's a big-girl thing!
text: My granddaughter is a girly-girl, so anything that the “big” girls do is an automatic favorite.  She was very talented with her application - and decorated two friends in no time.  It was “spa time” for an afternoon.  Great choice for keeping the girls busy.

title: Five star imaginative play!
text: Just the beginning of a collection - my grandson is having a ball with this - it's perfect for driving his sister crazy!  I like these fingerlings as they inspire imaginative play - and this raptor was the perfect choice to get a collection started.  My grandson gives this 5 star!

title: Love a mystery!
text: There's nothing kids love more than a mystery - and this one is really fun!  We always try to have a new and different toy at Grandma's house - and this is a favorite!  The kids love Hatchimals!  Well-made and fun to play with - and, a great addition to their collection.

title: A Hot Wheels winner!
text: For the Hot Wheels speedster in the family, this is a must!  I thought nobody could come up with a new idea for the cars, but they did!  Grandson and his Dad were wrapped up in this until bedtime, and then we went through ‘ “one more time”, over and over!  This was great fun to watch - and to see them having such a good time at Grandma's house!

title: Fancy Nancy fun!
text: Wow, are the girls having fun with this!  The first fashion show was greeted with great applause!  I guess every little girl loves the thought of a trunk of clothes to try on - and this makes that dream come true!  More fun for readers of Fancy Nancy!

title: Another popular Thomas toy!
text: Thomas is very popular with our very precocious 18 month old - it's difficult to stay up with his quick learning and short attention span.  But, he does settle down with almost everything to do with Thomas - Mom only has to show him once, and he's off on his own with this.  Toy is sturdy and holds up with rough play, thank goodness!  Good choice for Thomas-lovers!

title: Lots of fun for fans of Thomas!
text: For all kids that like Thomas - here's a play set that will keep them busy for hours.  Lots of alternatives for imaginative play.  Since we live by the ocean, the boat action is lots of fun.  More good stuff at Grandma's house!

title: Great 1st game!
text: Moving along slowly, 18 month old Jacob, is getting the hang of this - he's a very fast study, so it gets better each time we get it out!  It's just a great excuse to sit down and play - and he loves that.  Very few games for the littlest guys, so this is a great one to get him started.  And, it's fun for both of us!

title: Great for the grandchildren...
text: This is great for the grandchildren and other family members who can move fast!  This put Grandma on the sidelines, but it sure was fun to watch!  Everybody had a great time and a good work-out!  I can see us playing this one often.

title: Learning experience:  Useful thumbs!
text: This was a lot of fun for the whole family.  The thumbs are a bit difficult to put on - I ended up with a sore thumb afterward because of a slightly awkward position - but I'm old!  The younger kids were really surprised to see how often we really need our thumbs, so there was a learning experience.  Wish so many props needed to be provided.  Really different game - because of all the props we opened, we won't be playing this as often as I thought!

title: This pet tote is going everywhere we go!
text: This is just perfect for the little ones who, for some reason like allergies, can't have a real pet.  And, thank goodness it comes with a cat and dog - so there's something for both of the twins!  The pet carrier looks very much like my cat carrier, so I'm hearing, “It's just like Grandma's”.  Lots of good practice for caring for a pet - and maybe someday, when the allergies have disappeared (we hope), they can have a real pet!

title: Lots of fun with all the projects!
text: Thank goodness for this - it came just at the right time!  School's out, so the age old question of “what can I do” is heard consistently.  Fortunately,  its arrival coincided with an older cousin arriving from the north, so she and the 7 year old twins have been working on one project after another.  Having the materials for 12 crafts is a great idea - and it's leading to more activities.  The rock painting is leading to hikes to find more rocks, and a trip to the craft store for more paint.  Everyone will receive a painted rock for Christmas this year!  Good activity item!

title: Perfect for our 18 month old!
text: This is such a cute toy - and there is everything there that Dad has, so our little guy is ready to go!  It didn't take him long to figure out the clubs, and he has the knack of putting down cold!  For a first golf set for an 18 month old, this is perfect!

title: Great toys for the beach!
text: A great trio to take to the beach.  Perfect size for little hands.  Well made and easy to keep clean.  Very happy with these toys at grandma's house!

title: Great backyard sprinkler toy!
text: Finally, we have warm enough weather to get the sprinkler going in the back yard.  This is especially fun for the little guys, who are intrigued by where the water's coming from.  This was an instant hit and kept everybody cool until the sun went down!

title: Well made, quality toy!
text: There's something intriguing about cars that have garages.  My great grandson plays with this for hours - the colors are bright, and there's just something about taking things out and putting them back at this age!  Very happy with this toy.  Well made quality toy.

title: An immediate favorite!
text: An immediate favorite for my 18 months old great grandson.  More fun in the sand at the beach.  This is colorful. Well made and easy to keep clean.  So far, he carries it everywhere!  Great toy!

title: Probably the beginning of a collection!
text: My grandson was off and running with this Screecher - he knew exactly how it worked and he was absorbed for hours.  It does everything he expected - his Dad came to the rescue a couple times, but consulting the directions got us back on track for more fun.

title: Your “angels” in the pool will love this!
text: These Funboy inflatables are absolutely fantastic.  The 7 year-old twins love them - and these wings, in particular, lend themselves to all kinds of play.  They're huge, and every kid in the pool wants to join in, so it's great for making friends!  These are sturdy, easy to inflate, and more fun than almost anything else in a pool!

title: Fun in the bathtub!
text: Fun in the bathtub - fun that can be washed away when we want to.  More fun at grandma's house, where we always try to have something new and different and memorable.  This was a complete hit with our precocious great grandson who hated baths until this came along.

title: Good activity at grandma's house!
text: We're always looking for fun activities at grandma's house and this fills the bill.  With some adult assistance, my granddaughter made a very cute Llama pillow - and enjoyed every minute of it.  Something to take home with her memories.

title: A hit with my grandson!
text: My grandson was thrilled with this mosasaurus as he had been to a museum recently and there he saw the real thing.  He informed me that this is actually an extinct aquatic lizard rather than a dinosaur.  I wondered when I saw the fins!  So, this is going to terrorize swimmers in the pool, I'm certain.  Since we haven't put it in water yet, we don't know what to expect, but, so far, this large prehistoric lizard is a hit!  I wish it had come with some explanation.

title: Beautiful doll with long, lustrous hair!
text: This doll was an instant hit with my Asian granddaughter - particularly the length of her hair.  She immediately went to work creating new hairstyles!  She becomes the “little sister” to the Asian American girl doll my granddaughter already has.  All the clothes we have fit this doll, too.  If there is one drawback to this beautifully-made doll, it's that the eyes don't close.  Can't imagine why they decided on that omission.  It's an “oh, well” for my granddaughter, though.

title: Spectacular hair!
text: Really cute doll with spectacular hair.  Looks like it will last through many stylings!  Trendy, well-made clothing.  Great alternative to the much more expensive American Girl doll.  Soft body for lots of cuddling!

title: Great introduction to decoupage!
text: This is a project for Grandma's house and it promises to be fun and result in a keepsake for my granddaughter.  This will be her introduction to decoupage and this Piggy set will start us off with something easy.  Checked out the instructions and materials provided, and it looks like we'll have no trouble with the step by step.  She will love the finished product.  I'll amend this review if I have new information!

title: Beautiful doll!
text: The perfect solution for the child who wants an American Girl doll.  These dolls are just as pretty, their outfits are attractive, their hair will bear lots of combing and re-styling - they're perfect, and a lot less expensive.

title: Perfect for Grandma's house...
text: This is the nicest starter puzzle we've seen - and it will work best with some parental supervision.  I love any toy that brings and parents and children together - and, since it has cardboard pieces, if we expect it to last awhile, some care must be taken.  Nice box to hold the puzzles, great artwork on the puzzles.  When my grandchildren visit, I love to have something new and different to show them - and these puzzles were perfect.  To my delight, the 7 year olds found fun in helping the youngest great grandchild with the pieces.  Just hoping those cardboard pieces last!

title: Lots to keep baby's attention...
text: Oh boy, has this made a difference with the great grandson!  He is fascinated with all the sights and sounds, and loves the turning wheel.  It is very colorful and loaded with things that make sounds and music.  It attaches to almost everything with Velcro straps, so can be moved around, or lie on the floor.  He's just sitting up, so this is the toy that keeps him busy while Mom is getting something done!  This is a winner!

title: Building it is a ton of fun!
text: I was hopeful that this would still be appropriate for the twin grandchildren - just turned 7.  The building part was lots of fun and they spent lots of time making changes and getting it just the way they wanted.  Unfortunately, it was really too small for them, so they took delight in the fact that they had built it for their younger cousin - which necessitated taking it all apart, and re-erecting it on a different site!  So, boy,  did they have fun building it!  All was definitely not lost because they were too big for it!. The younger grandchild, 3, is thoroughly enjoying the house - spending nap time inside!

title: Lots of pieces!
text: So many pieces!  This kept us all busy - my 7 year-old grandson needed some help, and just keeping all the pieces contained was work!  The older grandchildren seemed to appreciate this much more - so their help was appreciated.  The final result was fun!

title: All comfort and joy, cuddles and cuteness!
text: A Marshfellow - who on earth thought of this?  He's the softest, cutest stuffed “personality” we've seen and held.  When unwrapped, everyone wanted him, including the dog.  At first, he seemed appropriate for the 7 year old grandchildren, who are s'mores addicts - necessitating a purchase of the graham crackers and chocolate - but the look on the 18 month old's face won the day, and Marshfellow went to him.  The cuddliest, softest, marshfellow, with the sweetest expression - this little guy is all joy and comfort!

title: Great idea!
text: These are a great idea - but they require parental cooperation.  Since I have twin grandchildren, I quickly ordered a second set, as I could see that this would allow them to send me letters, pictures - all kinds of their creativity.  Linking it to a parent's smart phone is what makes it happen, so Mom or Dad need to be around to help out with this.  The books are sturdy and the dry erase works well  with the Crayola products.

title: Something new in grandma's house!
text: Taking baths at grandma's house just got to be more fun, because now, there's a baby to wash!  This is a very cute little baby, in a colorful bathrobe.  So glad to have these little inducements - they make things so much easier, in what may be the first bath in a strange place!

title: Perfect for the older child, when a younger one arrives!
text: This arrived just in time for a new arrival in our family, so it was a perfect gift for the older child.  Since this is a multi-racial family, the baby's skin was a perfect match for grandpa, and was an opportunity to share some good conversation about this.  Never expected this to be a learning experience but it was, and a good one!  Little baby, Joy, is being tended by her “Mommy”, just like her Mommy is taking care of the new baby.  A winner!

title: Beware of the launch!  Lots of fun!
text: Easy to set up, this was in immediate use at Grandma's house.  One problem that arose was that the “launch” was too energetic and sent the car flying across the room, so some supervision is needed to get things lined up and the launch mechanism handled with just enough power to get the car to its destination.  It did keep my grandson busy for a good length of time, and it was a toy he asked to take home, so it looks like it's another winner for Mattel.

title: Fun at Grandma's house...
text: We're having fun with these at Grandma's house - welcome signs on the fridge are just the beginning!  My first grader twin grandchildren were plenty busy sending each other messages.  The “goodbye” messages on the fridge were sweet, and are still there and awaiting their next visit.  More fun!  Sturdy letters, made to last through many communications!

title: Family fun with this LEGO toy...
text: Lots of fun at Grandma's house putting this together.  Ended up being a multi-generational effort, and that was something I hoped for,  The Disney princesses are a favorite, so the twins were anxious to see what the finished product would look like.  Lots of fun.  Good thing we had lots of zip=lock bags for all the parts when we had to leave it for awhile.  Always looking for toys we can enjoy together - this one fills the bill.

title: Lots of possibilities with six sets!
text: Six sets of dominoes - all well-made. My senior center was considering getting a dominoes group together, and these set it in motion.  Folks were assigned a table and game by the color of the dominoes, so different colors came in handy.  Dominoes stir up a lot of good memories for older folks, particularly.  These would provide a great way to get families started in dominoes as well - and a great game to take to a family reunion.  In the beginning, I wasn't sure what I would do with six sets, but now I see!

title: Good for imaginative play...
text: My grandson knows better than I just what the appeal is of this toy - it's a formidable-looking vehicle, and he seemed to know just what to do with it!  It's difficult for this Grandma to stay ahead of the curve in providing some new play experiences when they visit, but it looks like the Blaze is a winner.  My 7 year old took to it right away, and it kept him busy for hours.  I always know if I have a hit if they ask to take a toy home, so this one passed that test.  Looks well-made to last.

title: Beautiful doll - less $ than American Girl!
text: This doll is much prettier than the picture reveals - and the size is just perfect for a “best friend or younger sister” for those much more expensive American Girl dolls.  The clothing is good quality and timely - and it's possible to order more clothing which is less expensive than AG accessories. The Glitter Girls offer most of the same AG experiences at a lower cost.

title: Quality toys perfect for little hands.
text: Great for toddlers' little hands - they roll easily, they're brightly colored and feature many Disney favorites.  Well-made with no sharp edges, these are a good introduction to cars that roll around.  The is a great group of toys for Grandma's house - and more than one child playing together.  Fisher-Price quality and Disney for the fun and imagination.

title: A simple toy in a complicated world!
text: Not every toy has to have remote control, flashing lights, a jillion songs and bright colors.  It's a relief to find just plain old toys that fit small hands, and encourage the imagination.  I didn't know anyone was still making toys like this!  As a grandma who tries to have interesting things to play with that are slightly off the “grid”, this spiffy little convertible and the mouse driver filled the bill.  Bravo - a simple toy that does nothing but sit there and wait for little hands to push it!

title: Perfect for the “Frozen” girl.
text: This is a child's dream - particularly a girl captivated by the movie, Frozen.  Since the girl in question has a twin brother, we like the fact that it will hold two, up to 130 pounds, which covers our bases nicely.  We're having no trouble running this on our large, grassy backyard.  It does require adult supervision until everyone masters the controls and the speed is set.  We're in a sidewalk neighborhood with a nearby park, so it's easy to “drive” to the park and have fun on the concrete paths that abound.  So far, everything is working well.  I'm sure this will get a good work out over the holidays, so if any problems arise, I'll amend this review.  We have a very happy birthday girl!  PS, her twin brother got a tractor!

title: Great assortment of magnetic letters...
text: These were meant for a teacher in a classroom, but we're using them to leave notes for each other, and to work with our first graders to help them make and read words.  There's a wonderful assortment  of magnetic letters so this makes learning fun, and the children can see by the notes we leave each other how important good communication is.

title: Kids love Peppa Pig!
text: Our pre-schoolers  love Peppa Pig, so this was an immediate hit.  Easy to turn on, it turns off automatically in ten minutes.  A child can turn it on and carry it around in the dark to the way to the bathroom.  So far, we've had no trouble with it.  Strictly battery-operated - no plug in.  The light going on and off is very intriguing to the young ones - so some parental oversight is probably a good idea,

title: Great for interacting play/learning time...
text: This is a good toy for the pre-school set who are just starting to think about reading, spelling, etc.  The different color letters are visually attractive, and kids enjoy playing with them to form words.  Even our precocious 2 year old was attracted to it and wanted to get in on the action.  This is a sturdy learning toy and should last through many years and children.

title: Fun, challenging games...
text: This is a great game, and lots of fun.  Frankly, my daughter and I have been practicing our team strategy for the upcoming holidays, as we plan to have some spirited, winning play!  So far, all games are fun to play and offer a challenge.  Working together reminds me of that old battleship game of years ago which our family loved.  We're going to give this game a good work-out in the upcoming months, so we may be able to amend this review with more information.

title: A great tool to experiment with coding...
text: Although I'm not entirely "up" on this technique of enlivening your screen time, my granddaughter understands it completely.  In her online teaching classes, she is now able to add the "special effects" that make learning more fun.  I'm glad to know that coding is not just for fun, but can be put to a good teaching purpose.  This motion sensor kit is just what she needed to get started to create quizzes and animation.

title: For the toy they want to "take along"...
text: Few toys are as portable as this one, for the child who always wants to take a toy along.  It's full of surprises for the younger set, who enjoy fun around airplanes.  The toy is well made, colorful and "transforms" easily.  Fun going up and down the ramps.  My younger grandchildren give Super Wings a "thumbs up"!

title: Great idea - lots of playtime!
text: My granddaughter is delighted with this tea set - and finding that she could decorate it to her taste was just icing on the cake!  She has been busily decorating everything with pink roses and green leaves,  The booklet is full of great ideas, and the set itself is sturdy and well-made.  I like the case for storage, and she does, too.  No trouble getting her to fill up the case after play.  This is really a great idea - so much more than just a decorated tea set.  Very pleased with this, and my granddaughter loves it.

title: Good selection of cars!
text: A good selection of Pixar cars - some we don't have in our collection.  They're well made and brightly painted and roll smoothly for all the speedways and roadways we have set up.  So far, they are being kept in the nice case they came in, which is unusual, but means they are being treated as something special!

title: No assembly - just lots of fun!
text: One of the best things about this toy is that it does not have to be assembled - you just pull up and everything clicks into place, ready to go.  No track to put together, unless you decide to attach it to your speedway.  So far, the action of the "corkscrew" has provided plenty of fun as we try out more cars and have time and distance races.  Another good choice for grandma's house, where there is always something fun to play with.

title: One huge, fun pool toy!
text: Wow - this is one huge pool toy!  We are definitely super stars with our grandchildren!  When we brought this out, I wish I had taken a picture of their reaction.  Once blown up, which was less difficult than I imagined, this accounted for hours of fun in the pool.  Since we live in southern CA, this will be a year-around pool toy!  Looks well-made and sturdy.  Takes rough play!

title: Give your child an "aha" moment!
text: This is the perfect solution for introducing a microscope and discovering the unbelievable world beyond our normal eyesight.  It's a genuine "aha" moment for children, and encourages them to discover all of the intricacies of everything around us.  With 60 images to whet their appetites, my twin grandchildren are vying for the shared time, and exclaiming over and over about what they are seeing.  The voice of Bindi is charming and informative.  One of the best things I've found to expand my grandchildrens' horizons.

title: Great game for the younger ones!
