text: This is a visually very cute and appealing game for toddlers - probably 2-3-4 years old will love it.  What this grandma likes is that it is very sturdily built and has few parts to get lost - just the animals, who during the game, fit into slots traveling around the barn.  Less chance of parts getting lost!  Love the interaction with animal sounds - lots of laughs along the way.  This will be a special game to be played at grandma's house.

title: Perfect for my young great grandson!
text: This is perfect for the young one who is too young for a remote car.  Lots of stuff going on - action, noise, etc.  My three year old great grandson will love this when he comes to visit.  He's just getting into Lightening McQueen and Radiator Springs, so this will get his immediate attention.  Glad they are making a good-sized car without the remote - just what this grandma needs!

title: Some adult help required...
text: This was immediately opened, and in no time, my granddaughter had the streamers in her hair.  She was hard at work with the mermaid scales when we had to pry her away for dinner!  She did need some adult help with some of the items, but since she loves everything mermaid, she will continue to spend time on this until all items are made.  The little mermaids are very small, so we had some trouble with them - and they are more to look at than to play with.  All in all a good craft set.

title: Great addition to Barbie's world!
text: There's a lot going on here - and lots of different things to keep imaginations busy playing with Barbie.  This is just another good addition to Barbie's world, and since Mommy goes to the spa occasionally, now Barbie can, too.  If there are any cons, it would be the tons of small pieces which always seem to get lost after a while - especially when there is a brother horning in!  This is a lot of fun play for my six-year-old "glam" granddaughter.

title: Brings Radiator Springs alive!
text: My grandson flipped when he saw this track set - which looks just like the terrain around Radiator Springs!  So much more realistic than plain track sets.  This comes with one Lightening McQueen car, which is fine, because we have a large collection of others.  Very happy to see the authenticity of this track set!

title: Fun play for two enchantimals...
text: This is really cute and my granddaughter launched right into testing out all the fun things for the "doll" to do.  There is only one doll that comes with the set, and that was a disappointment, because play is always more fun with a friend.  So the need to go to the store to get another "enchantimal" was relentless.  We did, and she's having a lot more fun with it - but I would recommend two playmates as part of this set.

title: Perfect tub toy!
text: Barbie's dressed for beach fun, so it was natural to take her with us on the next beach excursion.  It was fun for my granddaughter, but, frankly, I think she had more fun with it in the bathtub where Barbie could snorkel!  And, it was fun to find a dolphin the the bathtub!  This is a good Barbie toy for bath time - no problems with sand!

title: Another great Barbie toy!
text: This is a must in the world of Barbie.  I thought my granddaughter had everything possible for Barbie play, but this added a new wrinkle and was welcomed with oohs and awe.  The carriage rolls well and fits Barbie to a tee!  And it was good for hours of imaginative play.  Another hit for grandma!

title: Another great toy at grandma's house...
text: This is another great opportunity for Dad and son to put their heads together for a couple of hours.  Anything  Despicable Me is very popular around here, so this chance to put a super fancy, crazy car together got their immediate attention.  Then the fact that it transforms, was an extra plus.  Another great toy at grandma's house.

title: Good family game!
text: Here's a card game that can get the whole family involved!  Anything Lightening McQueen lights up my grandson's eyes, and when he can get the rest of us in on the action, he's a happy guy.  This is fun - sound-effects are great.  Good family game!

title: Good choice for Dad and son interaction.
text: My six year old grandson seemed to know exactly what to do with this - a friend has one, so, with a little help from dad, he was off and running.  He's a fan of anything Despicable Me at this point, so this is a winner!  I'm happy to find something that requires some time.  Too many toys get used and tossed aside - but here's one that requires some real interaction.  Good choice.

title: Disappointing - not getting raves.
text: Not so crazy about this toy - the shimmer is pretty "wooden" and, compared to other toys, it feels flimsy.  Destined to break quickly, maybe.  So far, it's getting attention, but not in the way Barbies do.  I got it for my six year old granddaughter, and maybe she has just outgrown this sort of plaything.  Not sure that even a younger girl would get much out of it, either.  Disappointed.

title: Absolutely gorgeous!
text: Absolutely gorgeous - hair, dress, and my granddaughter loves the star "background".  I'm hopeful that this will go on a shelf to start a collection, but, so far, it's too much fun to be played with.  Really promotes imaginative play.  Questions like, "could she be Cinderella going to the ball?  Of course she could!  Great addition to all the other Barbies.  This one is, oh, so special!

title: A quality toy for a young grandson!
text: This fire engine was a complete hit with my one year old grandson.  It's well made, with no sharp corners, rolls so easily even on carpet, the ladder goes up with no trouble, and the two firemen are just the right size for little hands.  This will be a toy that stays at grandma's house to be ready for visits, as I think it will capture his imagination for many months to come.  Very pleased with this - this is a quality toy.

title: Another Barbie sure winner!
text: What is it about horses - and especially one that dances, nods his head, walks and has a mane and tail that you can brush and braid.  This horse even eats carrots!  Lot's for Barbie to take care of, and she'll need help from my granddaughter!  Barbie looks sporty in her riding outfit, and the horse is a beauty, with a pink saddle, no less!  Lots of fun here - and big eyes when this was unwrapped!  Wish I had a picture!  This Barbie and her horse is a winner!

title: A 5 star dump truck from a bygone age!
text: Every grandmother needs a good dump truck in her arsenal, to be discovered when the grandchildren come to visit.  This is a great dump truck, large enough to roll around, with a nice little guy in the cab.  The truck dumps, carries dirt or whatever and dumps them.  No remote control, just a good old dump truck from a bygone age!  These toys are becoming more difficult to find.  No flashing lights, no songs - just a neat truck to roll around and dump whatever.  So far, the 2-3-4 year olds love it, and don't ask me where the remote is!

title: Fun for the whole family!
text: This game came out of the box to be played immediately upon arrival!  Lots of laughs - the 6 year-old twins loved it, and were making so much noise laughing, that soon Dad joined in.  Just when you think that there couldn't possibly be anything new on the game scene, something like this pops up.  The  family is having lots of fun with this!

title: Great Minions game for all ages!
text: I've seen a lot of new versions stemming from the original "Pick Up Sticks", but this one takes the cake.  I thought having a Yeti in our Spaghetti was fun, but it's nothing compared to Kerplunk.  The grandchildren and adults love this game, and I'm always reaching for a camera to capture the looks on young faces.  Minions are a favorite to begin with, so this game is right down everone's alley.  Lots of fun for everyone!

title: Wow - the pictures don't do this one justice!
text: Your first reaction to this play set is the SIZE of it!  The pictures don't do it justice, as it includes a transformer more than a foot high, and enough track to run at least three feet.  This is an addition to the wild and wonderful things my grandchildren find when they visit Grandma, and this will blow them away!  I got a little carried away checking it out myself.  It isn't often that we can say a toy far exceeds our expectations, but this one makes the grade.  Well-made and sturdy, this promises to be a favorite in Grandma's toy collection.

title: Like captain Queeg and his marbles...a soother!
text: It's actually fascinating - and does spin easily and continuously,  I haven't been able to effect the one hand spin, but I can see that, with practice, this will be possible.  Why spin?  That 's the only thing that's bothering me.  I'm so old that I remember an adage that condemns a person who "does not toil, neither does he spin,". Guess they were talking about a spinning wheel, but perhaps there is a correlation - as I understand that those who spin and weave, are quite contented people. I have a vivid imagination, so I'm picturing a group around a conference table saying,"why don't we manufacture and sell a thing that spins."  This must be like the "pet rock",  only better because it does something, and there's a human connection.  The pet rock just sat there.  Is this like captain Queeg and his marbles? Aha!

title: Great game!
text: I ordered this and Downspin - hoping for games that would get kids and adults involved and away from their devices!  I highly recommend both games!  As a grandma, I try to have something special and new when they come to visit.  With these two games, I succeeded big time!

title: Great game!
text: My reason for ordering was to find a game that both our grandchildren and the adults would enjoy.  The fact that it's a learning tool is an added plus.  Best of all, It's fun to play and needs concentration.  It's one game that gets everybody to put down the phones and pads!

title: Very impressive - good quality.
text: Wow - is this impressive!  I see that this is probably just the beginning of a collection!  We're just getting into the Marvel Lagends thing, and Thor is definitely a great place to start!  Since I won't be the one playing with him, I can only attest to the quality of this figure, the detail, the unexpected size of him and the various attachments.  Wow, is my grandson going to be impressed with him!  I will add some reading material about Thor to make this a well-rounded experience.  Wow, again - but will they all be this expensive?

title: Legos are always a winner!
text: Another winner for grandma's house!  Although I thought that my granddaughter would show the most interest in this, my grandson was equally involved.  The twins are 6, and it is more difficult by the year to always have something new when they visit - Legos are always a safe choice.

title: This one goes everywhere!
text: This one is getting carried everywhere.  Very cute and so well made.  And, just the right size to not take up a lot of room when we're on the road.  Very sweet and fun to play with, says my granddaughter.

title: Great as pool toys!
text: Was looking for balls we could play with in the pool - balls we could throw back and forth with no danger of hurting anyone!  Also, the fact they float is a plus.  When the little guys can't quite get with volleyball in the pool, these balls are something they can play with - easy to catch or find in the water - good size for playing catch.  Not advertised as a pool toy - but they are just what I was looking for.

title: Brings back great memories of Disneyland!
text: Wow, was the timing perfect for this to arrive - after a trip to Disneyland!  Pirates of the Caribbean was a favorite experience, so to have this arrive a couple days later was pure joy for one 5 year old boy!  It's really a very nice replica of the pirate ship - the cannon and Capt. Jack Sparrow were also well done.  It all looks fairly sturdy - so one hopes it will last through a lot of hard play!

title: Loaded with magnets - something different!
text: Half the fun of these is just seeing and feeling these strips for the first time - they're soft and bendy and full of magnets.  Before they think of making anything in the pictures, they're rings for fingers, bracelets and "let's see if we can join them all together for a necklace"!  I wished there were more different sized pieces - you're kinda restricted to building everything out of the same size strip.  But, the strips are colorful - maybe there could be more of them - the set is fine for one child but not quite enough for two playing together.  Best of all, it's different - my twin grandchildren had not seen it before, so it did provide a couple hours focused play for them.

title: Great activity at Grandma's house!
text: This is a perfect activity for Grandma and grandchild  - first you gather the flowers together, then choose which you want to preserve, then set up your place to do the pressing, and then.with a couple days to do the pressing, you go on to complete the chosen project.  For us, it was a bookmark for Grandma!  Although the age suggested is 8+, my 6 year old was completely intrigued and competent to follow the instructions.  I was looking for something I could do WITH her, so this filled the bill.  An older child, obviously, could enjoy this with little assistance.  A good idea - brings up identity of flowers or leaves, why to preserve them, and the enjoyment of something you made yourself!  Good kit!

title: Great choice for a first baby toy!
text: So bright and soft in his little strawberry swaddle suit!  Little hands will have fun taking the baby out and putting him back to bed.  Our little guy is probably too young for this now, but it was a good choice for him because he is captivated by bright colors, and will spend lots of time checking the baby out.  Well-made - obvious quality, this promises to last for many years of fun.  Safe, sewn-on eyes.  This is a good choice in first baby toys.

title: So soft - just keep an eye on those eyes.
text: This is the cutest, softest bunny - and the baby loves the rattling teething ring attached.  I had never seen a bunny quite like this one, so snapped it up!  If I wanted to change one thing, it would be the eyes - which look to be plastic and probably glued on.  I have always felt much more secure if animals for young babies had eyes that were sewn on, and couldn't be bitten off and swallowed.  So, we'll be watching carefully!  Other than that, this is so soft, and is going to be a favorite for cuddling!

title: A great answer to a most-wanted toy!
text:
The kids (6 years old twins) love this. They've been wanting an "electric car" forever, and this a little different than what they planned - but they claim it's more fun. We like the parent controls that allowed us to start them off at 2.5 MPH. Fortunately, we back to a wilderness trail - both paved and dirt, side by side, so we've been able to try it out on both. I would recommend helmets, especially if you're on hilly terrain. Maybe I'm over cautious, but when you see "your own" take off on one of these, and they are controlling it with joysticks they're not quite used to, I felt better seeing the helmets! Although we haven't taken what I would call "long" trips with this, we've had it going for an hour or so several times, and the battery life is good - compared with so many "toys" that run down just when the fun starts!

Since I'm a grandmother, I wasn't involved in the assembly, but I'm told that it was a cinch. I was relieved, as I'm famous for choosing toys that require hours to assemble, and then fall apart with use! No problems here.

I have some safety concerns, but I think, with parental supervision involved, things will be okay. I'm not sure I'll ever want it up to 5 mph, though! I can attest to it's reliability and stability on both pavement and dirt. It doesn't seem to tip - but I wouldn't want to take it off-trail! That's just my caution talking again. This is a thrill-a-minute for the kids, and as long as the parents are closeby, I'll be "five star" happy!

title: An all-time favorite!
text: How to get the kids to sit down, quiet down and focus!  This is an age-old game that kids and adults can enjoy together.  Although it's pretty stress and tension-free - and you can enjoy "brain-rest", there is some strategy involved! The kids love it, and it's a great after dinner treat - "We can play Don't Spill the Beans if you eat all your carrots"!  A couple games is enough, but the interaction with the kids is so nice before bedtime.  Some games take too long, or are too high-powered and get the kids too wound up.  Don't Spill the beans is just right!

title: A Christmas Hit!
text: This toy was the hit of Christmas Day.  Easily set up with the help of Dad, the play was endless - at least it kept the young ones busy so that dinner could be prepared!  After the kids got the knack of what was possible, it was pretty much non-stop fun to the exclusion of a lot of other toys.  Hot Wheels cars have been a favorite forever.  Everybody gave the Front Flip Takedown a "thumbs-up".  Four stars because Dad had to step back in a couple times to make necessary adjustments.

title: The better, safer pogo stick is here!
text: Frankly, it would have never occurred to me to order a pogo stick for my 6 year old grandson.  I thought they went out with clamp-on roller skates.  But, the "beginner" aspect caused me to give it another look.  There's a base at the bottom that makes getting the knack of this a lot easier - and safer.  It easily detaches, when the jumper moves on to "pro" level.  Since helmets are the thing now, I felt I would not be adding danger to his life with this gift.  I'm impressed with how the pogo stick is put together - I checked to be sure it's operating smoothly.  The grips are good "hand-sized", the foot pedals are ample, and the base is skid resistant.  Since the grandson is already a jumper, this should add a fun way to express himself!

title: Great combination of fast cars and Star Wars starships - "carships"!
text: I've seen this toy in action, and it promises to be a new experience for my 6 year old grandson.  He's a Hot Wheels fan, and is also into anything that flies, so the Star Wars "carship" is the perfect toy to bring those interests together.  He'll be thrilled with the joystick - he's very proficient with all remote control toys - catches on very quickly - so he should enjoy getting used to new "controls".  I also thought this toy would get him involved with Star Wars - which opens up a whole new world of possibilities!  I've trusted Mattel's quality for many years, and rarely, do they disappoint me, so I feel confident that this toy will last long and deliver a fun experience for my grandson.  I'll plan to amend this review after we've put the carships to the test of time!

title: Very impressive;  especially the auto launch, land and hover!
text: The decision to order the Sky Viper Drone began with one aviation-obsessed Grandma's wish to introduce a six-year-old grandson to flight in a more tangible way than zooming around the house playing "pretend".  The seed was planted and flourished when I got the Hot Wheels Sky Shock - the car that morphs into a plane and lands and takes off via a remote control.  My grandson quickly became adept at controlling that plane, and has had fun with it for months now.  Enter the 22 year old photographer grandson, who thought about putting a GoPro on the Sky Shock - impossible, as it couldn't support the weight and still fly.  So, that leads me to the reason for ordering the Sky Viper, which can be enjoyed and used with the cousins - Mason will learn even more about flight, and Ryan can experiment with the Sky Viper's video camera and figure out applications for his photography.  Christmas is my chance to get this plan in motion.  The drone is very light, and appears to be well-made.  It requires 3 AAA batteries and includes a lithium battery which can be re-charged.  I'm impressed with the auto launch, land and hover, which will take some of the difficulty out of operating the remote right away. My only concern is the length of time that the batteries will allow us to fly!  That's the frustration with the Sky Shock - very little real time in the air and for "touch and go's". Obviously, I will be amending this review after we've had a chance to operate the drone.  I've seen drones priced very expensively, which deterred me from my "plan".  I feel that this Sky Viper is a great opportunity to get an idea of what can be done with a drone, at a reasonable price.

title: Another great Barbie adventure!
text: I'd been looking for a toy that would make my granddaughter as happy as my grandson with his flying car/plane - which is something Dad enjoys with him.  She's a girly-girl, so a drone or flying car wouldn't do the trick - and, voila - the Barbie "flying hover board"!  What a great idea for girls who will still have something to enjoy with Dad!  I had to get Dad's help to get this going, and now he's totally involved! My grandson is offering helpful hints about the remote control, so everybody has got an air show going!  We've had a great weekend of fun with this, and hopefully it will last through many, many more!  What will Barbie do next???

title: A total hit with the grandchildren!
text: Wow, Grandma became a hero when she brought out this game!  Both twins said, "We saw it on TV and we've wanted it forever!"  It was played over and over this weekend.  What's good is that it can be played by all ages, so everybody got in on the action!  It reminded me of the fun we had in the "olden" days playing "Pick Up Sticks".

title: A hit with my grandson!
text: My grandson loves this super-animated garbage truck.  I couldn't wait for Christmas to see his reaction, so unveiled it for Thanksgiving!  It is so different than the other battery operated cars and trucks we have and it appealed to this Mater-lover right away!  It's much easier to work on the turkey dinner, when everybody is playing with a totally captivating toy.  The dogs liked it, too!

title: Intriguing new game!
text:
There's a little more about learning to play this game than I expected. The Utube video suggested by one of the reviewers is a definite help to get you started. The instruction manual that comes with the game is rather scary and makes it sound more difficult than it is. There's more strategy involved than expected, and I assume that one will get better at it, the more the game is played.

It's fun to have something completely new. We're practicing so we can introduce it to our family at Thanksgiving. Something for the adults to do while the little ones are enjoying grandma's stash of fun things for them!

title: Perfect new baby gift...
text: This is a very cute little lamb and just the right size for infant through toddler - and even this grandmother!  Very, very soft and silky - just the "feel" that the little ones love.  My daughter held it and said it reminded her of the satiny blanket edge that she dragged around for years.  The eyes are sewn on, so no worries about inquisitive little fingers peeling them off.  The perfect new baby gift - one that will be around as a favorite for years.

title: A bigger cheeseburger than expected!
text: This cheeseburger pillow is much bigger than I expected, so it makes quite a statement on my grandson's bed.  He's addicted to cheeseburgers so this could not be more appropriate.  It's also going to be good for his quirky sense of humor - "Grandma, I fell asleep on a cheeseburger!".  Now I must find a chocolate sundae for my granddaughter, so the search begins.  This pillow is made with very shiny, bright material and looks like it can just be wiped off to stay clean.  It is also well-made and will have no problem withstanding the inevitable pillow fight!  Good choice for the 6-12 year old.

title: Perfect for young Frozen fans!
text: I'd been waiting for an opportunity to choose a playground ball with the Frozen motif  for my granddaughter.  My grandson got a Batman ball, and they've had a good time kicking that one into the big net I got for their backyard.  This ball is very "kickable", and my granddaughter loves it as part of her ever-growing collection of Frozen items.  Sturdy, and seemingly indestructible as long as we keep it in the yard at home or school, it promises to last a good, long time.  My granddaughter is amazed that Grandma keeps coming up with more Frozen stuff!

title: Ariel is a hit!
text: I wish I had a picture of my granddaughter's face when she saw this Ariel doll, with all her hair ribbons!  Ariel is her favorite, so Grandma got five stars just for the doll alone.  It did take some help to get the hang of the ribbon preparation, but once she saw how the ribbon "machine" works, she was off and running.  Ariel will get lots of play, as she has so much Disney Princess stuff that will work with Ariel.  Most of all, I'm pleased with the doll, the mermaid "tail" and my granddaughter's reaction!

title: This is a great toy - a little fragile, so, hope it lasts!
text: This is a MEAN machine!  Took it up this morning to be sure that it works before my grandson comes for an afternoon with Grandma..First, it needs 6 AA batteries which I didn't have, so stock up with batteries!  Second, it needs a wide open area - a flat surface for racing, and some open air space when it turns into an airplane.  We settled on a weekend school yard, which worked out fine (my backyard is not big enough for all the fun with the "Sky Shock").  Suggest you do some slower stuff with this thing to get the feeling of the remote before you go to high speeds - but you'll need the high speed for it to take-off - which, of my gosh, it did!  Then, the real fun began, as it was another big learning experience working with the remote.  This is a great toy, but needs supervision in the beginning with older kids, and maybe all the time with younger ones.  We're ready for the big "reveal" this afternoon, and the grandson is sure to be blown away, as we're going to let the take-off surprise him!  Just hope we can land the "plane" as well as we did the first time!.  I don't know who it's having the most fun with this, my daughter/helper or me.  Can't wait to see my grandson's face!

title: Well-made doll for lots of play...
text: Another worthy addition to my granddaughter's collection - we especially like Ashlynn Ella, as she makes such and easy transition form short dress to ballgown.  This is a particularly good doll for a little girl with a big imagination, as it will be easy to see Ashlynn go to the ball and meet the prince in her new ballgown.  These dolls get pretty vigorous play around here, but seem very sturdy, and so far have stayed totally intact.

title: Beautiful children's toy!
text: This is an absolutely beautiful children's toy!  Each vehicle is painted in bright colors and, besides the dexterity this pre-school skill builder provides, there is recognition of the types of vehicles - an ambulance, fire engine, ice cream truck, taxi, school bus and more.  Every piece is well-done, right down to the red lace and "needle" (actually a wooden dowel).  On top of that, everything fits in a wooden container,which, itself, looks like a piece of fine furniture!  I had to check the price twice, as $10 on Amazon seemed a fantastic bargain!  This is a toy that our grandchildren's children will find in the attic in perfect condition!  I'm totally delighted with this, and so is my great-grandson.  In the land of plastic, weird sounds and flashing lights, this toy is a jewel!

title: Great idea for some real teaching!
text: This is a very cute kit for playing school - with lots of materials to do some real teaching!  The dry erase boards are colorful and sturdy, and hold up well, maintained by the eraser included.  The pad for drawing and the tablet with various games with colored pencils, were of immediate interest to my 5-year-old grandchildren.  I think that, at this age, you or an older child need to start them off to show all of the possibilities.  In the folio are pockets for all the items, which will help to keep all materials intact.  I counted all 225 pieces - there're all there!  I can't figure out how to store the little bell, but other than that, this is a good choice for spending some quality time with children.

title: Great for quiet time at Grandma's.
text: This is great fun for my 5 year old grandson.  I try to have some play items for quiet time at Grandma's, and this fills the bill.  Since my grandson has a twin, I can see that I will have to order a Frozen Scra-fitti for his sister!  They're both really into coloring and this new technique is, so far, fascinating, and is giving them a new form of fun.  Very pleased with this.

title: Totally lovable - and it teaches counting!
text: This is a very sturdy toy for the toddler - to push around, and to learn about numbers.  Good sound quality - clear music and speech.  This toy looks like it will last through several children.  The kitty's face is sweet and friendly.  No good for cuddling, but lots of fun, and a unique way to learn to count!

title: Very special unicorn!
text: My first figurine - my granddaughter, 5,  is interested in unicorns, and this is the perfect one to start her collection.  Made of a softer plastic,  it promises to stay intact through all play.  I particularly like the unicorn's face - beautiful, friendly eyes.  The rainbow colors of mane and tail, are very colorful and lend that extra special interest.  She's is delighted with it, and immediately let her imagination carry her away with stories about the unicorn.  Very pleased with this choice.

title: More creative fun at Grandma's house!
text: This is a treasure trove of drawing and coloring materials - which is fascinating to our 5 year old twin grandchildren.  They love the pictures included to color, and I can see that I'll very soon need to find more.  They love experimenting with the different types of colors - they're used to having only crayons, so this is enough to keep their attention for hours.  We always like to have something interesting and new at Grandma's house, so this totally fills the bill!

title: More fun at Grandma's house!
text: Another great addition to fun at Grandma's house!  Easy to set up, easy to store when not in use.  So happy with all my Franklin games - good quality and sturdy enough for years of play.

title: Looks like a lot of fun!
text: This doll is probably a bit too advanced for my five-year-old, but to give it some more fun, I ordered a matching wig.  She is deep into Barbie dolls, but I think this will give her a new experience, and will let me introduce Alice in Wonderland.  Hoping for a good seguay to explain Madeline Hatter!  I'm always looking for something new for her - Grandma has to stay up with the trends!

title: Captivating for a 5 year old...
text: WOW!  This a captivating toy for my five year old grandson, and he really put that car to work!  Quality looks good, ease of set-up is good, and it looks like it will survive a long playing season.  It gets more difficult all the time to find toys for Grandma's house that the kids look forward to playing with.  I wish I could get more cars.  They are pictured, but I can't see that Amazon has them.  Four stars because play, after a while, is limited by having only one car.

title: It's working!
text: I was looking for a toy that would separate my grandson from the TV and my IPad, and it looks like I've found it.  My grandson is a precocious five-year-old who has more high-tech saavy than I.  His Dad was able to handle the hook-up (pardon the lack of proper terms) and my grandson was off and running with his Moff Band in no time.  So far, it is a favorite toy, and keeps him off the couch.  It requires his Dad's IPhone app, so it does unite father and son more than before.  So far, so good!

title: Another fun playset for a granddaughter...
text: This combines the fun of Play-Doh with the ever-popular Frozen charactors and my five year old granddaughter loved it.  Since she owns other playsets, she knew what to do with everything, and it provided several hours of fun for her right away.

title: Colorful, well-constructed toy!
text: This is the cutest boy doll, with lots of interesting activities attached.  It's larger than I expected, and all of the learning experiences are larger, too.  Very sturdily constructed, so it should be a favorite toy for a long time.

title: Five stars for Grandma!  This is a winner!
text: I couldn't get this out of the box fast enough for my 4+ year old granddaughter - a friend had one and she had been able to play with it during a playdate.  So, she knew what to do, and quickly entered her "play" world.  It isn't always easy for a grandmother to choose toys that will really catch on immediately, but I have a winner with this one.  Five stars for Grandma!

title: Hours of fun for my little granddaughter!
text: The doll is larger than I expected and I'm glad, as there is just more hair to style!  My little granddaughter, 4 1/2, is all girl, and loves to work on her own hair.  So, when she saw Christina, she couldn't wait to get her hands on her hair.  I will probably get some more barettes, etc. so she has more to work with.  She puts flowers in her own hair, so I'm sure Christina will have them, too.  I'm very pleased with the doll.

title: Good with Barbie DVD...
text: Bought this to go with the Barbie DVD - 4 year old granddaughter had lots of fun with this.

title: Love these playsets...assembly, with the help of my friends!
text:
I got the Fire at Fusel Lodge, Air Attack Training Playset and Smokejumper Training Base. I agree with most of the pros a few of the cons of other erviewers! Assembling, for me, (80 year old Grandma) needs a lot of help from others, but once it's all laid out, it's hours of great fun! I'm fortunate to have an area where I can leave it set up for the grandchildren's (4 year old twins) visits. It's great to have something fantastic at "Grandma's House"! So far, so good with the sturdiness - even though the play gets pretty exciting and rough.

I like the fact that it is good, clean fun (now I'm sounding like a Grandma ) with a good, clean message - put the fire out, help people, get there quick, etc. Some of those other action figures scare me! I love airplanes, so it makes me really happy to see these kids having such a good time with these playsets. They're a great addition to all my Disney Cars and Frozen stuff.

title: Good purchase!
text: We got the horses for my four year old twin grandchildren  (boy and girl) because we planned to spend a day at the Del Mar Race Track, and wanted them to get in the "horsey" mood!  It worked;  they brought their horses to the track and raced them - and really got into the excitement.  Their horsies are a great reminder of our fun day - and they play with them often.  They're well-made and look like they'll last through the rough and tumble!

title: Great toys - Grandma has fun with them, too!
text: Wow - my grandson is glued  to this toy - he's a bit young for it, and needed assistance to figure the "transforming" out, but now he's an old pro!  Seems to be well-made - and helicopters and fire trucks are his favorites at this point.  So, I see a long life for these toys, as I imagine they're only the beginning of a collection.

title: Part of the nightly bedtime ritual!
text: Well-made to endure the pulls, tugs, drops, etc. of my 3 1/2 year old granddaughter, I expect these jammies to last as long as the doll, Baby Stella, herself.  They were an instant hit, particularly accompanied by the bunny slippers.  She is able to take them off and put them on with minimum assistance, and this is beginning to look like part of the going to bed nightly ritual, which is all to the good!  Perfectly satisfied with the doll clothes!

title: The perfect baby doll!
text: This the cutest, softest baby doll imaginable - and my granddaughter, 3 1/2, loves her.  I will be buying outfits for Christmas presents, as she has no problem dressing and undressing Stella.  I'd been looking for a baby doll that was soft and cuddly - so many of them are hard and rigid.  I highly recommend this doll - it's well-made and should last long enough to be handed down!

title: Great!
text: Best toy I have found for an airplane-loving grandson!  He's three years old and can't wait to see a real aircraft carrier now!

title: Maybe grandson was too young!
text: Great little plane that went with his aircraft carrier.  But when  I visited last, I found the plane missing a wheel and gear housing and consigned to "crashing" on the carrier - which is just taking play to a different level.  So I give my grandson an "A" for imagination and the plane a D- for being too easy to break.  My grandson is 3.

title: Lots of fun to watch
text:
This large truck talks and tumbles and keeps my grandson completely enthralled. He's almost two and right now it seems best to have an adult watching and supervising. He wants to ride on it, which isn't the purpose! He loves the interaction, particularly the singing. This toy is going to get more play as he gets older. It's very sturdy so will be around for a long time, hopefully!

I had to add the results of my grandson's Thanksgiving visit. He LOVED the truck and played with it more than any other toy. The family got a kick out of it, too!

title: Great fun for my grandson!
text: My grandson - 11, was totally enraptured by this toy - in fact, he was not available for conversation for hours!  Finding something that will capture his imagination has been difficult, but he was off and running with this transformer.  I don't understand all the appeal myself, but it spoke to him, which is what I hoped for in giving it to him!  This toy is good for hours and hours of productive play, and seems sturdy enough to withstand all the many fights, flights, etc. etc.

title: Granddaughter loved this!
text: Arrived well before Christmas.  Look at the matching hairdo. :)

title: It wasn't what i expected
text: It's not what I expected. Very poor quality, the object came dirty and stand with a glue.

title: PERFECT
text: SO much better than DJI's anemic (and overly priced) kit bag for the Mavic 2 Pro.  This bag is perfectly sized for portability-meets-functionality.  Plenty of accessories fit in the bag, the quality of the bag is GREAT, and the cost is exceptional... I have to say, I really love this bag.

title: A must have.
text: A must have.  They take a few minutes to install each time, and the locking mechanism probably won't last too long, but these are essential if you are flying indoors or near people.

title: Just buy it.
text: The manufacturers of this set need to hire me to take better photos for here in Amazon.  The photos don't even come close to telling the story of what a nice chess set this is. I absolutely love it.  There is a great balance between the charm of being handmade and yet being precisely constructed.  This is really a beautiful chess set.  SO worth the money.  Really, (shhhh) I would have paid twice the amount for this quality and aesthetic.  Hopefully there isn't some factory full of skilled 8 year old slave labor.... I can't imagine how they made this nice of a set for this low a $.

title: Good starter set
text: Good starter set.

title: Super fun temporary tattoos for boys and girls!
text:
These tattoos are super cute. You get a “fierce” collection of dinosaur and dinosaur related tattoos that are super easy to apply to arms and legs and wherever else you really want to put them. These are fun and perfect to keep your kids entertained for a while. These tattoos would make perfect stocking stuffers for the holiday season coming up and at just $7 really don't break the bank at all.

They last about 3 to 5 days, depending on what your kid does really. They are very easy to remove with either baby oil or rubbing alcohol, personally I prefer the baby oil since that is just so much more gentle. All in all a fantastic find.

title: Awesome dump truck!
text: I am so happy I got this one. My nephew absolutely loves it. His mom, oh well sacrifices must be made very now and then. It is a good size, fits well in my own hands even, so not sure how someone can compare it to a matchbox car since it is easily like 7 inches long, 3 inches high and like 3 inches wide! It is well made and has quite a few moving parts to it. The lights on it work which is awesome and has a horn that honks! How much better does it get, don't ask mom! He loves it and that's all that matters. Great little truck and fantastic find in my eyes!

title: My nephew can't get enough of these
text: My nephew LOVES these cars and can't get enough of playing with them! I have to admit I don't mind playing with them myself since these are just too cute. They remind me of the movie "cars". There are well made and actually a pretty good size, which surprised me. They come in a set of 3 giving you plenty to play with. The pull back mechanism works very well, but let's see how long it will take for my nephew to wear them out, if he can that is. They are pretty light weight so no issues there with him being able to pick them up and playing with them (he is almost 3). I have been told I am the "bestest" aunt there is :) Not bad for just $16.

title: Nephew approved!
text: I got these for my nephew and he absolutely LOVES them. Thankfully these are not too small so I don't have to worry about a swallowing hazard! They are made out of a sturdy plastic and painted very well. They can stand on their own and I love that you have a set of 3 so that gives them something to "reenact" and play. The little selection of a zebra, elephant and cheetah is just perfect in my eyes since these are some of my favorites and I hope they will be his as well. Yes they are not proportional to each other but I don't care about that really. i like that they are a good size and I don't have to worry about him loosing them or worse swallowing them. Plus it will be easier with his little hands (just turned 3) to get a good grip on them and he won't struggle). My sister says he loves them and she has found him having given them each names and they take turns getting sleepovers, too cute.

title: Fantastic little dinosaur couple!
text:
I got these as a gift for my friends little boy and he LOVES them! The moment he got them he wouldn't put them down. He was completely in love with them and they are his new best friends now!

These are well made out of a plastic-rubbery material and look like the real deal, as much as you can in a small plastic reproduction. I didn't find any sharp edges that would make me be concerned that he would hurt himself on these. Yes the dinosaurs have teeth but they are not that pointy that I would be concerned and neither was his mom. The paint looks pretty cool and I love the fact that they come in a pair of 2 so he can pretend that they are either friends or battling. They are a decent since, not too big for an almost 3 year old but also not too small that there is a risk of him swallowing them or loosing them right away.

All in all these are great for little boys and girls who love dinosaurs. Rumor has it he was found with them in bed the next morning having a little sleep over, oh boy :)

title: Beautiful challenging puzzle, but mine was missing a piece
text: My husband purchased this puzzle so that we would have a quiet activity to do while I was recovering from surgery. It is a beautiful, high quality puzzle, and very challenging to complete. Unfortunately, we got it completed and discovered it was missing a piece. We were very careful while putting it together over the course of about 6 days, and didn't use the table for anything else during that time, so that was very disappointing. We were planning to glue and frame this puzzle... We may do it anyway as a statement on 2021. Lol

title: Used for zen Gardens, good color and texture
text: It came fast and on time Khan and I like the colour of the sand. I used it for Zen gardens for gifts, and was very placed

title: Pretty cool
text: Pretty cool

title: Great for dressing up with a doll
text: My daughter loves dressing up with her doll.  The quality is what should be expected at this price point.  It serves the purpose and she is happy.

title: Cute
text: Really cute!

title: Puurrrfect Purple Gund Pusheen
text: Purple, Gund, Pusheen!  Yes, yes, yes!  I'm a big fan of Pusheen, I love anything purple and I've had Gund stuffed animals since my childhood.  This sweetie is just right for shelf next to my desk. If you know anyone who likes Pusheen, this is something you should consider.  The packaging and shipping were spot on as well!  Gund products are all treasures and Pusheen has a special place in my heart.

title: Five Stars
text: I love this tiny box, very fun.

title: Super cute!
text: Bought them as a gift for my mother in law who loves Golden Girls. She loves them and will be keeping them in the box and keeping them safe. Such a cute idea and love some of the other designs from other shows as well.

title: Easily rips
text: My 10 month old loves it. He fell on it kne time and it easily ripped. Pretty sad when you just open it and it is so easily damaged. He is a little baby too. So sad. Otherwise the concept is great they could make the connection to the pieces way better. We have better things they could have used to connect them together. Snaps would have been better all around. Too many big gaps  other than that it is fun for my 10month old. Oh and it should include at least 50 ball pit balls but doesn't. You guys could add that in so parents don't have to buy some on top of this purchase.

title: So cute and so bright!
text: My kids loved putting these in their forts and placing them throughout the house in a scavenger hunt. Such perfect little glow sticks.

title: Cute designs, bags too small to fit everything
text: The idea is brilliant and saves money in the long run. The problem I have is the bags didn't fit the stuff it came with. The coloring books would not fit in the bags. I could have gotten bags that would have fit for the items at the dollar tree.  I love the products in this kit but the bags could be better. The design is adorable though. Please consider making it so all the products that are in this kit can fit in the bags. Thank you!

title: Perfect size, hard to scratch off.
text: These are the perfect size for my homemade scratch offs for parties. The only problem I found was it was difficult to scratch the sticker. It will be difficult for people with arthritis to really scratch the surface. I wish these worked better in that way. Otherwise the idea and size behind it was perfect for me.

title: need to make more!!
text: I love these concepts! I wish I could find many more products just like this! They need to make more!

title: relaxing
text: passes the time by and is very relaxing to do.

title: nice
text: I like how they ate individually wrapped as well.  They ate hoping into Easter eggs.

title: I love buying these for the classroom prize boxes.
text: The balloons are a bit hard to blow up, but the assembly is easy and I love that the kids are getting to build something. They also have a tiny noise maker inside that only adds to the fun. I've been buying them for 2nd and 3rd.

title: Super Cute, the kids loved them.
text: Yes the graphics look a bit off, but the quality is really nice, and the lights are bright (it has a turn off button so they last longer). I bought them for my sons class Christmas party and the kids loved it! Well worth they money!

title: Yeah ... fan girl.
text: What can I say?!  Aquaman now sits with Duncan on my shelf.  Just wondering why FUNKO decided to make Aquaman's head larger than Duncan's!?  I've collected those characters I like from movies/TV shows that are dear to me.  I know "Dune" was postponed but Aquaman was lonely ... ha!  Neat item ... keeps reminding me that I have to wait for the movie!!

title: Nothing is cuter than this character ...
text: I didn't find myself attached to the Star Wars characters (although I loved the movies) but I have Baby Yoda!!  He's so very adorable and I can't wait until Season Two to see him develop more and use the 'Force' more often (kudos to Jon Favreau for so creative).  The two collectible toys are unique: although plastic, I have them where the light shines off the eyes and I get the warm fuzzies looking at them!  So very cute ... I plan to get at least one more of the sets.

title: missing puzzle pieces
text: I just bought 4 puzzle maps from this company - ALL of them had multiple missing pieces - I'm deeply disappointed, as were my gift recipients.

title: missing puzzle pieces
text: I just bought 3 puzzle maps from this company - ALL of them had missing pieces - I'm deeply disappointed, as were my gift recipients.

title: missing puzzle pieces
text: I just bought 3 puzzle maps from this company - ALL of them had missing pieces - I'm deeply disappointed, as were my gift recipients.

title: Love the old school games!
text: I'm teaching my 4 year old granddaughter how to play and she is loving it!

title: Great way to teach kids patience
text: Colors are bright and easy for my granddaughter to put together

title: Child loves them
text: I bring these out once a week and the child I watch can play with them for at least an hour.

The one delivered to me didn't even have the seat on it. It was impossible to figure out how to attach it. The folding mechanism is one of many finger traps. I will look for a safer, more reliable, and honest, brand. This one's going back.

title: Wild and Crazy Toy
text: The balls pop all over the room, which made the adults laugh. It is very loud and crazy. Probably too much. I like it. We'll see whether the child in question likes it too. Be prepared to chase the balls all over the room, tape the speaker to control the volume, and buy replacement balls. Oh, and D cell batteries. What this toy needs is a type of cage that would fit over the top of it so balls will go down the tube as intended, and not fly randomly to roll under the furniture, Part of me does like that wild side of it though. This is not a dull and boring toy.

title: Heavy metal for babies?
text: My immediate thought was that these are dangerous. The metal part of the key is about an inch and a quarter long. Although rounded at the edges, they could hurt someone in any number of ways, including to the teeth. They should be removed from the market.

title: Battery Compartment Impossible to Open
text: It requires a very specialized screwdriver to open the battery compartment. I have a large variety of screwdrivers but not the one that is needed for this simple task. I understand that it's a safety feature but other toys are just as safe without having to go through the frustration of not having the right screwdriver for the job. What a shame as the gears are a lot of fun.

title: Piece of trash.

Pieces were a joy to put together. Love Pomegranate Puzzles.

title: Beautiful game, fun, and deep
text:
Not the easiest game to learn, but they give a one-page instruction if you intend to play immediately upon opening. I suggest you do that, look at the one-pager, and answer any questions that come up in the course of the game with the full rules. Was easy enough to get our first session going with my 6-7 year olds. Kids will have a better time with the game if they are decent readers--the box says 14+, but I can't think of any reason why a child of any age that can read couldn't enjoy this game.

I wish I could give this game 6 stars for craftmanship. All the parts are well thought out, easy to use, and beautiful. The way different birds interact with each other and the dynamics of the game is wonderful. We've only played once so far, but I anticipate this will make a regular appearance at game night.

title: Very cute for the little aspiring chef
text:
I bought this for my 6 year old grandson who loves helping and learning in the kitchen with his mom and dad. I've been looking for an apron for a few weeks to get him for Christmas. Etsy has some but they're not cheap. Some charged extra for a chef hat. Though this set isn't cheap, the quality is what you pay for. It is a nice lightweight cotton with pockets. The apron & chef hat are made of the same material and match in color. I like that it's 100% cotton as if it is stained (which I'm more then sure it will be) it can be cleaned with Fels Naptha soap to get it a bright white again.
The chef hat is adjustable with velcro. The design is such that it's not intrusive of the overall look.
I don't know how old the child is with the set on in the item description but I do not think this would fit a 10 year old. I believe the max age would be 8 years old.
I was able to purchase this for a certain precentage off in hopes that I would review the product honestly.

title: Fun, Fun, Fun
text:
Used these at Easter. I bought the cheapoh plastic eggs at the Dollar Store. Put these lights on inside of each egg. Then hid them in the living room with the lights dimmed for our 4 year old grandson to find.
He squealed finding every single one for about what seemed like 50 rounds of hiding and finding the eggs.
The lights never quavered.
Great price for what you get.
Then-
We used em again during the celebration of the San Antonio Spurs National Championship WIN this week. (We're VERY DEDICATED SPURS FANS). Our whole family wore em towards the end of the game with only the tv lights on in the room. It looked like indoor lightning going on.
So much fun and sure added a memory with the lighting effect.
They fit both adult and children's fingers.

title: Good quality for so many at such a cheap price
text: My 4 y.o. grandson wanted a great white shark, a dolphin and an orca whale for Christmas.  Total for the 3 would've cost more then the total for this assorted bag which includes the 3 he wants.  I was worried about the quality as I normally purchase Schleich products and hold these types of toys to Schleich's very high standards.  I am very surprised at the quality of this bag of toys for $10.  I don't think they'll last long enough for him to reminisce over when he's 34 y.o., but they should last til he's tired of playin' with them.  Who knows, I may be surprised.

title: 3 y.o. Grandsome loves it!  VERY HIGH QUALITY FELT HAT!
text:
I didn't expect much for a child's costume hat BUT this is. Plus it's durable in shape while 3 year old puts it thru the ringer.
I scoffed at the price. Now I see why it wasn't cheap...it's not the cheap version!

title: Lil' grandson loves it....
text:
I have bought a lot of the Take-n-Play sets. They are sturdy, colorful, and most of all portable. They are designed to hold a couple of the trains inside, so no loose Thomas & Friends gettin' left behind inadvertantly. The one thing I like the most is that all of the Take-n-Play sets can be connected to one another.
There has not been one set that my 2 y.o. lil' man doesn't love playing with. They keep him occupied for at least 30 mins @ a time.

title: Complicated
text: Nephew had a hard time following instructions but enjoyed the game once he figured it out. Played twice and it went into the cabinet.

title: Very helpful
text:
It definitely helped my son with his multiplication.
They are sturdy and can be written on.

title: Five Stars
text: this is a wonderful toy ...my son is 2 years old, and loves this. made very sturdy!

title: Cool concept, NOT a sturdy toy.
text: My kiddo loved this for the brief time it was useable. Unfortunately the first time he threw it the toy pretty much exploded into pieces. I know he isn't necessarily the most gentle with his toys but this one seemed particularly poorly built.

title: Trash
text: I paid for ten.. twice and got two. What an absolute garbage experience.

title: Wonderful to play indoors, even for small kids
text: Gave it to my 5 year old granddaughter, she loves it

title: Absolute rubbish! Don't buy!
text: Firstly, received box with two of the same miniature. When removing BOTH figures from plastic sheet to glue together, the cheap plastic pegs that are supposed to go into the base broke off…ON BOTH! plastic is brittle and cheap. DO NOT BUY THIS GARBAGE!

title: Cheap garbage. Absolutely do not buy!
text: Plastic is extremely brittle with small parts. Pieces break easily, do not fit together well, feel cheap. Do not buy!

title: I bought two
text:
One for each of my granddaughters and let them pick the color scheme (we didn't buy them for table top game playing).

Amazing sculpt and the flexible wings allowed me to "pull them down" to get into a good position for painting then they slowly released back into upright position.

Loved being able to paint them off of the stand to get into hard to reach places.

Will be buying more of this series.

title: Love this series of dragons
text:
My grandson requested a deep dive into the "gold" but I was able to get so much more depth than I anticipated. Amazing details with nothing lost in multiple layers of paint. Metallic paint can sometimes obscure details but this sculpture was so well crafted I didn't even have to think about it. Now I need one for myself!

We're not players (he's only 10) so right now his dragon is battling some character from warhammer. Scale is great. And the weight and durability is terrific. I'm always worried about the warhammer characters getting busted but this dragon will weather many battles.

title: Surprisingly sturdy.
text: Both the stable and the horses are sturdy and have survived a 2 year old and gabby siblings since Christmas. Gets an A+ in my book. Worth every penny.

title: Second set of lacing toys
text: The first set which only had 6 animals was such a big hit I splurged for this.5 year old girl, 3 year old boy, and 2 year old girl love them. Many many laces in may colors reduces squabbling. 4 hours of pretty consistent quiet time from 3 toddlers is a miracle that is well worth the price. Great graphics and each one is about 4x4 inches in different shapes. Mommy is fond of the Melissa and Doug wooden boxes that the toys can be sorted in. I'd like to say the box could use a lid but if that meant putting them in cheapo boxes forgetaboutit. This is fine.

title: oh Play Doh how you've changed
text: For the better. Gone is the horrible stink, the nasty texture, the staining colors. Smooth, pleasant smell (almost no smell at all), and only the black left a color behind on the play surface that was easily wiped up with wet wipes. 2 ounce packages are the perfect size for toddlers and one container keeps little hands busy. The packages seal back up well (also better than original play doh) but don't leave the doh sitting out because it does dry out if not being kneaded.  Bigger sets are better value for the money but 3 toddlers are getting plenty of use out of the 10 pack. Combine with Melissa and Doug wooden clay tools for maximum fun.

title: Well made
text: Didn't have any of the problems with the holes mentioned in other reviews. 2, 3, and 5 year old loved them. 2 year old needs help but was determined to do it. The 3 year old said "it's too hard for babies" but after his papa said it's only hard until you figure out how to do it, he sat quietly until he figured it out. 5 year old wants more shapes. These are NOT patient children and we had an hour of quiet play each time they were pulled out. Nicely done.

title: Larger than I espected
text: Nice quality. 2 pockets. The containers are empty of course (thank you).  Haven't tried the diaper on the 12 inch dolls that we bought so don't know if it will fit them but confident it will fit ONE of her many babies. Very happy for the price.

title: Toddler-ific
text: We have several sets of the Melissa & Doug wooden magnets and live them all. The 2 year old, 3 year old, and 5 year old play with them on the magnetic board and in their wooden castles. They are not completely indestructible but they are the next best thing. Buy them all. And the magnetic doll sets as well.

title: I'll be honest
text: The adults like this better than the 3 year old. But we put it away for when he's a bit more patient about setting up tracks. We had fun anyway!!

title: I was a Midge girl when I was little.
text: Love you Barbie but Midge has more flavor. She is also not quite so.... strippery? Sort of a teenage version. Friendly looking and easier to dress. AND she has articulated joints which I didn't expect (what, me read?). Very useful since we brought a Breyer horse and she can RIDE!!

title: I was surprised
text: I thought when we bought the Brave game we might have set the bar too high for these games, but the 4 year old loves the LeapFrog kids and keeps finding new ways to manipulate the characters. And she is definitely learning to read!

title: Worth every penny
text: They all ( 1 1/2 year old, 3 year old, and 4 year old) love the magnets. I would buy any similar magnets from Melissa and Doug. We have the magnet version of paper dolls and they are loved also. Nice quality. As a side note, Mom grabbed the wooden boxes to use as drawer dividers, lol. They don't work well as storage since they have no lids, but they're very nice quality for other uses.

title: Just buy it
text: It's hard to explain how much fun this is to play with and to watch. I'm not sure what the tack box is supposed to be for. It's not really a box and appears to have treats on it. Making it a water trough would make more sense but I'm not sure every set you buy needs to come with one.

title: I ordered it because the dolls sit
text:
Unfortunately they slide off of the chairs pretty easily. I'm considering upholstering them. Possibly with velcro.

The tiny tea set is pretty nice, but they lose the cups constantly. The table was just badly thought out. Instead of one leg in the center, it really should have been a slightly lower four legged table. The 4 year old is pretty patient and is playing fine with it when no one else is around, but it's nerve wracking watching her try to play with the pieces with other kids around.

title: Sturdy case
text: Bought for a 3 year old grandson who is suddenly collecting lots of hot wheels. He and his younger sister take turns standing on it as a sort of performance platform and it has held up well. The case clicks closed with is an improvement over the ones my son had as a child. They were a bit more elegant, but had an "envelope" closure as I recall. I was always picking up cars that spilled out. This case is better even if it initially looks cheaper.

title: These are more fun than they should be
text:
Originally bought the Cinderella Klip Klop for the 1 1/2 year old.granddaughter. It had us all laughing. It makes a fun clippety clop noise when it descends and was easy for her to figure out how to use. She just adores it.

But the 3 year old liked it too. He just didn't want to play with the fat princess (that's what we call the Fisher Price princesses... I know, I know).

We bought this one for him and he loves it. He did trade bridges with his sister though. His bridge was more yellow not the tan shown here, and her princess bridge was blue. He hasn't noticed the blue hearts on the side of of the princess bridge, lol, but it's okay. They're both happy.

Now the 4 year old wants Belle Klip Klop. Of course, we'll get that one too.

title: I was a little concerned when I saw how small the package was
text:
But it's the perfect size for the 2 year old and he has to fight the 4 year old off of it. I will definitely be buying the additional sets which interlock to make the whole set up quite an impressive group. Works with the wooden or die cast trains. Folds easily for adults and for the 4 year old. The 2 year old enjoys folding the track but can't attach it to the garage yet.

I was able to tuck 2 trains into the carrier with the track for traveling. Not sure if you can do that with all of them.

Big success and sturdy.

title: So much cooler than the more expensive wooden trains
text: I can't believe I paid twice as much for the wooden train. This does work well with the wooden Thomas, as they have matching magnets, but I did go ahead and buy the die cast Thomas also. The 2 year old immediately tossed the wooden Thomas to the side (for a couple of hours, then retrieved him). Great value, works with his matchbox/hotwheels collections.

title: Great product for toddlers
text:
My grandkids (two and three years old) have most of the Dinosaur Train products and Thomas the Engine (that's the only Thomas piece they have).

They also use it to store and play with the dozen Hot Wheels cars that they have.

It's an entirely reasonable price with higher quality than I expected. I thought it would be a lot more flimsy. My daughter in law appreciates how easy it is to clean (shiny vinyl that is slightly padded).

The top zips closed so we haven't seen any issues that require velcro dots. Maybe if they had more of the wooden trains it would be an issue.

The only complaint I have is that I really need two and would like a different train track option rather than having two identical cases.

Added: I purchased this in April and two months later it is still in perfect condition, used daily, and loved by the boy and the girl equally.

title: Crayola- perfect for school supplies!
text: Crayola colored pencils are always good.

title: That made a little girl very happy
text: It's super fluffy and cute :)

title: Good for basic cans, not tall ones
text: Love these overall but not good for taller cans (servers and what not) FYI

title: Very Cute, Child loves it.
text: My child loves this. Very cute and she loves how monkey has water coming out of its mouth.

title: Not as expected
text: Louder than what I thought, can't change direction at all, and the string is easily tearable so that the pom pom is no longer there at the end. It alarms my cat instead of entertaining her. The toy vibrates and goes in any direction. The toy itself is made very cheaply if you look upclose and the battery it uses is inconvenient. Overall I had to return and I would not recommend for a friend nor is it giftable.

title: Hours of fun
text:
My eleven year old grandson loved this gift. He earned 74 points on his first try. We nicknamed this toy
"Simon Says on Steroids!" I like that it is sturdy and well made. I like that it keeps his attention, and has him moving his hands and working his brain.

title: Dinosaur lovers delight
text: My three year old grandson loved matching the dinosaurs with these dominoes.

title: Great toy for puzzle lovers
text: I bought this for my seven year old grandson as a Christmas gift. It was a hit, that is once he took the time to study it and figure out what it is. Since he didn't quite know what to do with it he started by reading the pamphlet of instructions that accompany it. Once he saw  there were many different ways the puzzle could be solved, he immediately began trying to solve it on his own. He spent about a half hour figuring and reconfiguring. While he didn't ever solve it in that time, he only stopped trying because it was time to leave. He explained to his mother that to put it away he followed the picture on the front of the box, he was quite pleased with himself.  I am confident he will spend many enjoyable times searching to solve this puzzle.

title: Wonderful puzzles. No Storage.
text: This product is A GREAT FIND for origami 'folders' and puzzle solving minds. I have had my eye on it for over a year, just waiting for the right time to give it as a gift. There is only one reason for a less than five star rating. I was very disappointed that the puzzles only came in shrink wrap. I was expecting a small box the papers could be stored in and think that would be a nice addition to the product. It would make it much easier to take the puzzles along when traveling to avoid the mess of having loose puzzles and no place to keep them. I bought it as a gift for my ten year old grandson who loves puzzles and origami. I ended up finding a plastic Sterlite container to put it in for him. With a storage box this product would get five stars from me.

title: Can't go wrong with Melissa and Doug floor puzzles
text:
If you have a puzzle lover I highly recommend Melissa and Doug. These puzzles are built to with young children in mind. My grandchildren have put them together over and over again, then passed them on to
younger siblings.

title: Great Birthday gift for a five year old girl
text: This was a huge hit with my granddaughter and her mother. Hours of fun creating jewelry for them.

title: Well used and loved
text: My seven year old grandson enjoys creating things. He has an engineering mind so he loves legos and learning how things work, and he also loves origami, drawing, play dough, etc. When I saw this light up board I thought he would enjoy it because of his interest in drawing and his ability to stick to an origami project on a medium level, so I purchased it for his seventh birthday. He absolutely loves this. He uses it on nearly a daily basis. He takes it with him in the car. Tracing favorite things is really helping him build his drawing skills. If you have someone in your life who shares these types of qualities with my grandson, then this will probably be the PERFECT gift for them. I also purchased the carrying case that goes with it.

title: Sturdy and solid. Developmentally appropriate, practical, and FUN.
text: Looking forward to seeing my grandson pushing this airplane around and filling it with his treasures. I have purchased two of these carts before, one with a hedgehog on the side and the other with an owl. Those were for granddaughters, they both had a larger cart capacity so they could sit inside. The cart helped them stabilize when they were learning to walk and then gave them many options for practicing their growing skillsets over the next several years. Besides the push and pull advertised, they put in and took out their treasures, took their favorite items with them all around the house, and sat inside while an older sibling pushed them around. This airplane probably lacks the ability to sit inside it and won't hold as much inside, but it has built in toys the other carts lacked adding additional skill sets to practice.  I especially like that children are drawn to the toy naturally, no added BELLS and WHISTLES, so to speak, get in the way of the child using the toy in ways best suited to his or her current creative, intellectual, and physical needs.

title: The perfect EXPERIENCE gift for learning and pleasure
text: My Grand daughter and her older brother LOVE this cook book. I was not sure how this three year old girl would respond to the Chef hat because hats are not her favorite thing, so when she put it on and took it right back off I wasn't surprised. I know she will grow into it. What really pleased me when she opened her birthday gift was her reaction to the book!  She loves it.  She sat down and looked through the pages while her mother explained that they could work together in their kitchen cooking yummy food.  About a week after she got the book I received a Marco Polo from them. My grand daughter wanted to show me the Cake Pops they had made. She held each one up, one by one, for me to see and told me they ran out of sprinkles. Her five year old brother had helped and as she held up the last few cake pops her older brother pointed out the tiny chocolate chips on them as a stand in for sprinkles. I can see many moments of learning and pleasure ahead as my grandchildren learn basic cooking skills with their mother through this little recipe book. The dress up apron and chef hat are a nice bonus, and I am sure some little girls would go right for them and toss the book aside. In this instance my main goal was met for this little grand daughter and her family. Soon her one year old brother, who shares the same birthday as her, will join in the family cooking experiences. This is a gift that can bring the family together providing mutual enjoyment and personal satisfaction.

title: Great for preschool age
text: Watching my four and a half year old grandson open this gift was very rewarding. He was truly delighted to have his own pair of scissors and couldn't wait to have his parents help him open the package so he could try his scissors out. He did need help to work with the cutting activities in the book which helped him learn how to manage scissors on his own and his parents taught him when cutting with scissors is or isn't appropriate, and what he could or couldn't cut with scissors. Every day he has a quiet time where he can choose quiet activities to do. Since he has shown he can be responsible with his scissors they have become one of his favorite choices to use when he creates during his quiet time.

title: FUN for all.
text: All nine of my grandchildren love this toy, from ages 1 to 13. It's one I keep at my house and sometimes take to theirs when I visit them. The little ones love shaking the balls to hear the little beads inside and watching the balls roll down the towers. The older ones love building the towers and positioning the ramps so the balls jump from one tower to another. This set has enough to build two towers of five plus two extra ramps. I also bought the original set, also a tower of five with a cute smiling animal to top it off, it does not have a ramp. This set comes with four balls, the original with three. I also bought an additional box of six balls. That makes a total of 13. With that many balls these toys have all the joy and fun of a marble run without having to worry about babies and toddlers being around marbles.

title: Very engaging
text: I purchased these for my 10 year old grandson. He absolutely loved this kit and built all 50 projects in two days and started all over again. I have always bought him a toy and a book for his birthday but lately he has said he doesn't like books. This kit includes a 'book' that he read completely as he built the projects. I don't think he even realized I gave him a book. It was the perfect gift for him. He told his mother he thinks he might want to be an electrical engineer. I highly recommend for anyone who loves to build with legos, do puzzles, solve problems, all things that require working with mind and hands.

title: Best Christmas present
text: This was the first present my grandson opened, and even after opening everything else he kept returning to this one again and again.  Sometimes not even wanting to put it down to open another gift.

title: A Hit Turtle Truck

We enjoyed putting this together and will keep it separated into the boxes for future use as well.

title: Very Pretty Puzzle
text: I like to put together puzzles while I listen to an audio book.  This was a really pretty puzzle, with enough challenge to make it fun and engaging.  I love its modern look and the hours of relaxation it gave to me.  I highly recommend it!

title: Greatest Advent for Kids!!!
text: Forget candy!  Let them open one of these up a night and watch how excited they get!  I thought they would stop caring, but with four kids, they each get to open one of the squares each night and we put the toys in a small box so they could collect them.  I love that they can be used and reused, creating nice playtime for days on end.

title: Definitely for Children up to Maybe Two or Three
text: Cute and fun little balance bike. Great comfortable, banana style seat and double wheels make it easy for young kids. Very short, definitely built for 18-24 months.  My friend has a pretty short two year old daughter and she went BANANAS over this little bike.  It was so easy for her to use and maybe a step above a baby walker.  This is a great transition bike out of a baby walker, after a child has figured out their balance and is ready to get the feel for a bike.  I'll be sharing this with my friends.  So cute too!

title: For All Ages
text: In full disclosure, I got this game to play with my 68 yr. old mother, who is young and vibrant, but experiencing a bit of a lagging memory.  Two years ago she had a situation with spontaneous amnesia for about 10 hours, which was horribly frightening for all of us, but especially for her.  Doctors say her memory is actually really good, but she has noticed a decline and it troubles her.  We have started playing this game as a way of exercising her memory and she feels more confident, while enjoying herself.  I didn't actually tell her that's why we were doing it, but I have noticed that she feels better about her memory even after a few rounds of this game.  Don't just play this game with kids--play this with your adults and seniors for a good exercise for your brain!

title: Cute Sea Turtle
text: This is more of a cotton fabric and less "soft" than you might expect.  That descriptor is really only tied to the fact that it's not a normal board book.  Still, this is a really cute little first book for children.  I love the baby turtle in the book and the bright colors throughout.  These are all excellent for young babies and children.

title: Fun Quad
text: First, it might take some time to trim it properly, so be patient. Start off inside, just going up and down, and then find that magic spot on the throttle that will allow it to hover. Take notice of the direction it tends to drift (if any) and adjust the trim. Once you get that taken care of, it's great fun. Faster than you might think, too. When the battery starts to fade, the controls will become "loose" and then it just quickly loses the ability to turn the propellers. Also, buy the crash pack! It comes with everything you need, including a couple motors, lots of spare props, a new shell and a battery.
