text: Hi quality craft supplies. Every thing is a little more durable in this set of supplies then other I have gotten. My daughter has loved the variety in this pack to make all sorts of things with! So many options

title: Durable and great for play
text: Perfect for any Disney fan! I got these for my daughter to play with and she has thoroughly enjoyed them! They are durable and are made of quality products. My daughter is tough on her toys and these have held up! Highly recommend!

title: Great craft!
text: My daughter loved making these! such a fun idea. she is almost 5 and did need assistance in doing, but it was a great hand eye coordination craft activity! came with everything you needed for it! This is also a great idea for a birthday gift so much better than a regular toy!

title: Perfect for a unicorn fan
text: My daughters have liked playing with these. Would be great in an Easter basket. The legs are really bendy and great for imaginative play!

title: Simply but fun!
text: My daughter has loved playing this game. She's almost 5 and she's able to do this with her friends without parent assistance. They love it. Simple and fun!

title: Cute for a decoration or for play
text: I gave this to my daughter as a gift she loves it and loves unicorns. The ribbon is really a beautiful unique touch. This is excellent quality stuffy and would also make a great decoration for a little girls room!

title: Beautiful decoration piece
text: So darling! This is such a cute decoration piece for my daughter room! It is fragile but came well packaged and in one piece! Beautiful quality and detail on it.

title: Storage case was awesome! Beads work great
text: These snap beads have worked really well. They snap together with ease and my 4.5 year old loves making jewelry with them. As a parent my favorite thing is that it came in a nice plastic container that made it really easy to store these!

title: Soft and cute!
text: So many different emoji options! Got these for my daughters to play with and they've loved these soft keychains! It even has a rainbow poop! So cute and fun would be great in party bags at a birthday party!

title: Fun for kiddos but a little hard to get out
text: My daughter has loved these. But I took a star as the pick really isn't enough to get this stuff off. We found that you really needed to break it open first otherwise it would take hours to get to the Dino. So we went outside with them and threw them on cement so they cracked open so we could then pick at them and get the Dino out.

title: Great for younger kids
text: Fun stickers that are great for littles! My 4 year old is able to easily do these her self and make all different face combinations.

title: Great hands in activity
text: My daughter has loved playing with this kenetic sand and as long as you store it in the container after use it has not dried out. It also has a good smell to it! And a lovely vibrant pink color.

title: Chunky paint
text: The paint does not go on near as smooth onto the squishy sad pictures. It looks more chunky paint all over the place. My daughter did love painting her Dino's but just not the pretty smooth look I expected.

title: Beautiful pastel colors
text: Work very well. My preschooler loves “painting” with these dot markers. The pastel colors are beautiful! The dot is smaller than some dot markers we've had but still really nice clear dot

title: Problem in the stuffing
text: Although this idea is great... The problem comes in the stuffing. The seam between the mechanical section and the stuffed animal are not put together well and Olaf's cotton stuffing has gotten all over my house.

title: Vibrant dinos
text: Really nice quality stickers. They are a little thicker than your average sticker and each come with their own backing. The Dino's are all vibrant in color and the colors have not faded since being stuck down.

title: Pretty small
text: Quite small for squishies. I wouldn't spend more than $15 on the set even though you do get quite a few they are small. Would work for a stress bad for small child hands. My two daughter have enjoyed splaying with them and I put them out as decorations in the house at Valentine's Day.

title: Kid approved! They loved it!
text: Both my daughters have loved this set. The rocking house is so cute! It is very easy to assemble. My 4.5 year old can do it completely in her own. I love how the box is in a unique shape and is not only for storage but also for them to play with the box gives them so much more to do with it.

title: Excellent directions WITH pictures
text: My daughter loved making these Dino's with me!! It was so fun! The booklet that came with it was very detailed and told us exactly what to do to put the models together. They dried up and hardened over night and they turned out so cute! Such a fun activity to do with my child!

title: Visually appealing to kids
text: The drum is quite large. But all the instruments easily fit inside which is really nice for storage. It is very bright and colorful. Both my children are attracted to its unique look and all the instruments work well. Made of good quality this toy is going to last us a while!

title: Baby loves it
text: So darling! My 18 month enjoys joining me in the kitchen with her very own mixing bowl and kitchen utensils. It makes cute sounds when she pushes down on the bottom and entertains her for a while.

title: For the Star Wars fan
text: Perfect for the Star Wars fan. Was very easy to put together. Has stayed together well. The legos are all excellent quality.

title: Great  Stem Activity
text: Such a cute wooden play set. Would make a great gift and I love how it promotes imaginative play. I was able to give my daughter directions in building, but also let her built her own things with it. I really like how it came with other pieces besides the wood blocks like the car ect..

title: Darling mulan set
text: darling Mulan set. Particularly loved the horse that came with this set. My daughter enjoyed it. She is almost 5 and did need some extra assistance in putting it together. Lots of little pieces as most legos have. Beautiful set though and love how it comes in a little book to keep it all together.

title: durable fierce dinos
text: So many awesome pieces in this set. I do wish it had a woman action figure as well as a man. my daughter still loves it though. The hook works well and actually winds back up.The main dinosaur is very fierce and nicely detailed. The eyes light up. The set it made of excellent material that is very durable.

title: Cute stamping and pen!
text: The magnetic drawing board is so fun! The little magnets on the corners work like stamps or you can use the “pen” to draw and write. Also, the board is divided into 4 different colors so when you draw or stamp on the board different colors come up.

title: Great fun for the kids
text: These balls are great fun and easy to inflate as they even come with their own pump! The colors were very vibrant, and the kids loved them. They are smaller so fine for dodgeball, but too small for kickball.

title: Great for pretend play
text: Darling armoire that is really excellent quality. The assembly directions were really easy to follow. I will say that it small so it does not store much, but has been great for pretend play for my girls as they dress their dolls.

title: Very durable! Click together easily
text: Great magnets! They click together so easy and come in lots of great colors! My kids will play with them for hours! They are very durable. My kids are rough on toys and they work great!!

title: Stretch and fling great
text: These things can really fling across the room. Despite stretching a lot they haven't not broken so are very durable. Comes with a bunch of different colors and Dino types. My daughter and her cousins loved playing with them!

title: Beautiful markings and details!
text: Ferocious looking dinosaur figurines that look like the real things! Daughter has enjoyed these immensely. Great detail even down to the little teeth's beautiful markings on both Dino's! Very durable!

title: Durable and high quality dinosaurs
text: Wonderful detailing in this set of 4 Dino's! They are very durable! Daughter has even taken them in water and they have held up great! Very sturdy! Wonderful pieces to add to any child's Dino collection!

title: Excellent value, it rips
text: I am overall very impressed with this unit. Bang for you buck you will be hard pressed to find a better value. The build quality is excellent and it flat out rips. Very fast. My kids love watching me drive it around the neighborhood.

title: Very impressed!
text: I was very impressed with the performance and build quality of this RC car. In my opinion this performs like some cars that are double its price. Battery life was ok, not great. Overall very impressed!

title: Not the best design or quality.
text: I am usually really impressed with Melissa and Doug products but this one was not up to the usual quality! At the base the bottom section came completely unglued on the last peg that linked to the base. Making it so we were always looking for that tiny piece that would roll around. This is also very large. So for a "decoration" on a bookshelf it is too big. It is better for the floor, but the design of not having the poll down the middle makes an item that is constantly knocked over and a bit of a pain to stack. I really loved the colors and the wood. Just had a few flaws.

title: Excellent quality spotted Dino!
text: My daughter calls this her leopard Dino and she loves it! Roads quite loud! It has wonderful detail in the talons. Eyes light up red which she also really likes that touch. She takes it in her imaginary play as it roars and scares the other herbivore dinosaurs around it! A nice addition for any Dino collector as the skin pattern is so unusual. The quality is amazing. Terra makes my daughters favorite play dinosaurs

title: Cute soft play book
text: My 18 month old has loved pulling on the different tails and I talked to her about the different tails and who they belong too. Such a cute book and nice and soft. A great one for babies as they can't rip it and can play with it.

title: A major win with the kids!
text: These are adorable and such a big hit with my daughter! These are a great value as so many surprises come in one egg! The sequence are a nice added feature plus they come in a HUGE unicorn egg! The quality is great on these! Make an excellent gift!

title: Cute some hard to snap
text: Fun little bag full of snapping plastic beads and bracelets and head bands you can attach the beads too. A little tough for little fingers to snap some of the beads into place. You can also snap the beads together to make longer necklaces.

title: A step above the rest
text: the kids love these paints! Great colors and I love the little wooden paint brush included with the set! Having the wooden brush makes it a step above most kid sets! Great for the classroom or at home. Vibrant beautiful colors!

title: The old school style is still a hit!
text: A throw back to my childhood! When this first came I wondered if my kids would take any interest in him as the look of these dogs are so different from the popular stuffed animals of today, but both of my kids have gravitated to him and love playing with him. My oldest loved writing a name for him on his name tag. I think because he's so different from there other stuffed he stands out more and really like him!

title: Perfect for the classroom!
text: A perfect STEM activity that really allows kids to be creative. I've been using them in a first grade classroom for part of a STEM center and they have loved it! The students like following the directions to make a planned out item or going off on their own and designing there own!

title: Cute owls and work great for kids
text:
Kiddos adore these!
I mean walker talkies are awesome anyway but than add the cute owl factor and my daughter adore them! We used them a lot when all the cousins were here they would go to different rooms and talk to each other. Volume was great as they didn't get too loud which is perfect for parent ears!

title: High class wood toy
text: Darling pulls device! It's great how this has the pulling and the walking feature so you are getting two activities for my toddler in one! She loves it and happily hits it and pulls it along. The wood quality is beautiful on it! Would also make a great gift!

title: Not a kid favorite in our house
text: Not a huge fan. The on/off is a button on the front instead of a Switch in the back which I don't like. Really hasn't held my kids attention much for my 18 month old or 4.5 year old. Songs and sounds are ok. I feel like you are just paying for the baby shark theme. I have similar type products that are better quality and my kids like more.

title: A new twist on wrapping a burrito!
text: A really fun play in wrapping something up like a burrito! My daughter loves her burrito babitos! They are very cute and the big eyes seem really popular with the littles right now. A major hit! Come cutely packaged so great for a gift!

title: Life like Dino!
text: [[VIDEOID:ef4b3895388e738d6dafdbfbd2ccd143]] Great dinosaur for any littles dinosaur collection! My daughter who is Dino obsessed loves this one. The features are very life like and she really likes how the neck moves and how the mouth chomps. Stands fairly easily on its own! Quite big but not overly so, so it is still easily storable.

title: Entertaining for my girls
text: Both my daughters have loved playing with this little critter! It sings and spins all over the place. It does come off what I believe to be it's feet pretty easily so we often misplace those and have to go looking for them. The tail also doesn't stay clipped in the greatest. But is still really cute and little girls love it! Entertains them!

title: A Dinosaur Lovers Dream
text: My girls have LOVED playing with this. The head acts as another little compartment in the tent and they love going into that section. They play in and out of this thing for hours. Set up was fairly easy! My husband didn't pay attention to the directions much even though they did come with them as it was a fairly straight forward set up. He was also able to twist it down. It is nice though when they come in a tent fabric container to slide them in which this tent does NOT, so hold on to the box because you'll need stick your tent back in it when you need to store it between playtimes

title: You basic shape sorter with a baby shark theme
text: Your basic shape sorter that plays the baby shark song and sounds as they put the shapes in or move the fin or top of the submarine. It's nothing fancy though. I wouldn't spend more than $15 on it, maybe if it also lit up it would be worth more. Baby girl enjoys the shapes but the sounds don't grab her attention that much.

title: Squishy and soft
text: You get quite a few in this bundle! A lot were unicorn themed which my girls love! They are very squishy and seem durable and soft. Kids have loved squishing them it keeps their hands busy.

title: Very detailed play set
text:
Play mobile made a cute product with this one with so many details! From the wheel chair to the potted plants or the class pet trantula this was a major hit with my daughter! I did have to put almost this entire thing together for my daughter. She isn't old enough to put these together on her own. I'd say she'd need to be 8-9 to do that and even still there might be some frustration. But she has loved playing with it! She plays school with it. So cute! So many classroom options even a bathroom with stalls!!

Some cons:
- some of the sticker decorations were not cut correctly and had extra hanging off (see image)
- this takes a lot of time to put together even for an adult. The way the pieces were packaged did not align with the directions so you find yourself digging for pieces from all different plastic packages and that in itself takes a lot of time.

title: Fun flashlight
text: I love B.Toys their toys are always excellently made! This is no exception! My daughter and nephew have been enjoying playing with this and shining it up on the ceiling. Also great for at night if they get scared in the dark! Easy to assemble and kids could figure out switching out the disks on their own.

title: Classic radio...classic sound
text: Take a step back in time with this classic radio! Works just like old radios use to! I've been using this with my daughter to understand technology from the past and how radio works. Also great to have in hand if we loose power! Battery operated! Is very nice quality! The sound is very nice.

title: Quality cabin not quality action figures
text: Darling set! My daughter loves building the log cabin. She is 4.5 and did need assistance in building  it. The logs are real wood and nice quality. I did take off one star as the action figures that come with it seem really cheap and don't match the quality of the log house. My daughter enjoys using her own action figures with it though.

title: Not the best quality but kids like it
text: This isn't the highest end product, but if your kid is a Star Wars can they will enjoy swinging it around. It is kind of flimsy so I do worry how long it will last. But gave a smike to the face of Star Wars fans in our house.

title: Amazing quality! A staple toy!
text: I love this classic toy! My daughter has enjoyed building with it. This is more of a classic set so my daughter does find herself pulling from of the newer Lincoln Log sets to add windows and doors. But it is still great and has so many pieces she can really build large structures. The quality of the wood pieces are amazing! A staple toy to have in every house that encourages creativity.

title: For the price I expected better
text: Got this for my nephews to play with when they came and visited me. They loved it because it looked majorly intense and they did love it BUT I would not say it shot as far as the description says it will. For the price I expected a little better quality and for the foam bullets to come out a little easier.

title: All the colors!
text: All the slime and I don't have to make it! Well that's a win in itself! Daughter has loved playing with it! Comes just as described in a rainbow of colors! A fun thing for kids to play with just keep it away from carpet it's a pain to get it out!

title: Everything you need in one place!
text: Everything you need for baby doll play in one place and at one price! Awesome! Piece this set out and it would add up quick! The dolls eyes even actually blink!! The mouth has some what of a hole so my kids can stick her bottle in there which they love to do! The clothing and pieces are all soft and excellent quality! And talk about the wow factor when you kid first sees it! This thing is huge. Notice roll of making tape placed by the corner of the box (gives you an idea of the size of all this stuff and how amazingly it is displayed). You really are getting so much! Kids can pretend to be mommy for times on end!

title: Great “pet” Dino for Dino loving kids!
text: Rawr!! Our Dino loving daughter loves this little critter. She loves her “pet” Dino. It growls and all! Having the cage adds a lot more for her to do with it. And is totally worth the little extra so you can have a cage with the fingerling. The packaging is great with “claws” dragged through it 😂. This will be a hit if your kid loves dinos!

title: Super cute idea!
text: Really cute idea! My kids love turning them self's into different animals as they read this book. I suggest having a mirror handy though so they can look at themselves.

title: Perfect gift for a 12-24 month old!
text: [[VIDEOID:a8b4fc42ae377e256d0092d6cdd7c325]] Perfection for that little toddler who loves to chase you in the kitchen. Give them there own little kitchen! It's small enough that I can tuck it away in the cupboard (major win)! Has soo soo many buttons for baby to touch and push. Little doors that open! So much entertainment for my 18 month old! She loves washing “her” dishes while I'm in the kitchen washing mine. Cute little sounds and songs it makes that encourage learning. This ones a keeper!

title: Darling set that incorporates early learning skills
text: Such a darling tea set for your little. My youngest is nearing the 18 month age and she loves it! She is just starting her understanding of putting shapes in matching places. I love that this introduces that with the various food items that comes in different shapes. There is one item that stays stuck to the tray, but everything else flows free. Love how the tea pot plays different sounds and the set has been great for imaginative pretend food play for both my daughters.

title: Stunning life like looking doll
text: This doll is stunning! It is really life like! Holds up to Madame Alexander usual pristine quality!  The skin tone is absolutely lovely with so many life like details! Perfect for my daughters collection!

title: Great little case! Daughter loves it
text: My daughter who is 4.5 has loved playing with this. She is in pre-k and particularly loves practicing the letter and number pages. She also created scenes with the magnets. The markers aren't the greatest dry erase markers. But they work. The eraser on the top of the one mArker also isn't super great so I ended giving her an old sock we no longer used to use as her eraser. The concept is great though and having a case to keep it all together has been awesome

title: Cute play pieces for doll play
text: Really cute toy set for baby dolls. My daughter uses it with her Bitty Baby Doll. Great for imaginative play. Also is a great gift and is displayed really well in the box. Even has a "squeeze pouch". My daughter loves pretending shes mom with this diaper bag set!

title: Feels like something is missing.... oh yes because you have empty spots
text: Comes with only one egg! So your kid opens it up and is looking for the eggs for the other train cars. Which is a gimmick to get you to buy more. We ended up just using a couple Easter eggs in the other cars. The quality seems decent. Nothing spectacular. I wouldn't spend more than $15 on this toy for what you get. Sound quality of Johnny Johnny is ok.

title: Entertains my child, one of her most loved toys
text: [[VIDEOID:341a337a3d4a72bb4f518e9a14f42c2]] My 16 month old is obsessed with this chair!!! She goes back to this toy over and over again. With my first child we had the yellow version that didn't have the lamp and I have to say this new green version is better. I didn't realize how much of a hit the lamp and side table would be. She loves flipping through the “book” and also bringing her own toys or drink to set on the side table. It is easy for her to climb in and out of. This toy has brought so much entertainment for her. The perfect gift for a baby! They will love it! The side table snaps in so easily and already has batteries so set up is a quick snap!

title: Major hit for any kitty fan!
text: My girls love kitties so this was a big hit at our house! The cats are very sturdy and will last a long time. The cats' post is all one piece and is also very sturdy! My kids like playing with the cats in their cat tree. The cats tree stays up on its own and you are able to rest the cats in it along with other small cat figurines we have at our house.

title: Cute idea...kinda cheap...all plastic pieces
text: [[VIDEOID:43aacdbf93b2cca26e361dfa2ec5b0f9]] Is this worth $98....no. It's pretty cheap plastic. Pretty cheaply made. Keeps my daughters attention for a little while. We do own a lot of character figures already so she uses those in the box car. But if you don't have those doesn't give a child much to do with it except use the remote control. Needs a lot of batteries. Advertised as ready to play....but that's not true until you put all the batteries in. Olaf spinning is cute. But would've even better if they could take the figurines off and play with them. Plastic track pieces. Which are pretty basic. Does get the initially wow from the child but ends up being a toy that sits in the corner of our playroom.

title: A great way to teach the lesson of helping animals
text:
[[VIDEOID:92b462552eb524211e99c9e368f7b0d5]] My daughter adores this thing. And it really is a cute idea. It comes out shivering and shaking and they make it feel better by giving it a bath. My daughter was so in to saving her kitty. It does make lots of different noises. And she can feed it and it hiccups! Which she loves. I really like that we could have a conversation about saving animals after. Instills a valuable lesson.
The reason I took a star off:
-Even after bathing it is pretty mangy.
-the sounds are harder to get to work the more she plays with it. So I'm guessing the battery is going out. So the battery doesn't last super long in it.

title: High quality!
text: Welcome to the most heavy duty figurines! For real! These things are super durable! High quality! Yes they may be a little more than other animal figurines. But they are worth it! These will last for years! My kids love playing with these families! They also come in a cute display box that has a backdrop of the family's habitat. My daughter enjoys using that when she plays with them which is an extra bonus! Great for incorporating imaginative play with real animals that exists. The polar bears are super life like in look!

title: darling tiger family
text: My 4.5 year old LOVES these animal families from Terra! These tigers were just as cute as other family toy animal figurines we have gotten. The quality is amazing! These really are going to last! The cubs are pretty small though so we do find ourselves having to search for them often as they might roll under the couch. But all in all fantastic toy that promotes imaginative play!

title: Give them some water and let them play!
text: My daughter, who is 4, has enjoyed playing with this set. Having the science cards would be great in a classroom or for older kids. With my daughter she enjoyed imaginative play with them while using her water table and playing in the water with it all. Gave her hours of amusement over the last month.

title: Great addition to a child's dress up box
text: My daughter loves running around pretending she is a kitty in these. My only real complaint is it is hard to get them to light up regularly. But the fur quality on them is really nice. And my daughter loves having these in her dress up box.

title: A hit with my daughters
text: Can I keep this for myself the adult?! Lol. I think it's so cute. But so do both my daughters! My daughters are 4 and 16 months and they both love playing with her. The bobble head feature just ads an extra cute feature. The boots pop on and off easily. The “hair ties” snap on and off as well. Super cute!

title: Cute fridge!
text: My daughter loves this toy! She is 4! She loved how you can push the ice out. The fridge really is cute. I did take off one star though because we have had problems with one of the fridge doors popping of while they play with it. But other then that it is a cute toy that has held my daughter and her friends attention.

title: Darling set with so many characters
text: There are a lot of fun unique bricks, like hagruds pink umbrella, the light up Brick, pumpkins, etc. . . This is a really cute set! The kids especially like buck beak!! The bottom could be a little sturdier when you put it together. That's really my only only complaint with this set! So many darling Harry Potter Characters in this set!

title: Easy to make no mess slime! That sparkles!!
text: For the little girl who loves slime this was a major win. My 4 year old loves making slime with me and even better it had glitter! Love how it was no mess came with containers to store it in and everything! The process was really simple and made the slime quickly and with ease. The only downside is they advertised a picture of a unicorn in the directions as a trinket that comes that you can “bury” in your slime. Yes, it says that the trinkets or characters you get vary, but it's kind of disappointing to a 4 year old when there is a unicorn on the picture and they got a cloud 🤷🏼‍♀️. Who wants a cloud over a unicorn!?

title: Wonderful set with a lot in it!
text: My 4 year old daughter loved putting this set together with some help from me. There are quite a few pieces so she did need some help but was able to do a good chunk of it by itself. I was really impressed with how many characters this set included! Goofy, Mickey, Minnie, and Pluto!! We love duplicate legos in our house and this was a great addition to our growing collection!

title: My Girls love it
text: Baby girl loves using these and sticking them on the shower door. My 4 year also enjoyed practicing her counting with them. All you need is a moist wall in the shower or tub and they stick. As it drys they eventually fall off.

title: Excellent quality, darling outfit
text: Beautiful doll outfit! Everything in this set came in excellent condition with no wearing off of glitter or anything. Seems like this one will last a while! The set comes in a nice display box so you can really see everything you are getting. Great if you are giving it as a gift. My daughter likes putting this outfit on her Wellie Wisher Doll or her stuffed animals.

title: Okay but the word making could use some work
text: To be honest my 4 year old enjoyed more color coordinating things and playing pretend baker with these then actually doing the alphabet things. We aren't to the point of 3 letter words much yet. But we did spend time recognizing the different letter, and uppercase vs lowercase ect. It would have been nice to have a stand of some sort besides just the cupcakes to grab from and sort and resort with to and from the cup cakes. Also as other reviewers have said having a picture of an elephant was probably not the best call when beginner learners are making the words. Best to stick with CVC, CVCe, CVCC, CVVC words. As an elementary teacher (which I am) I would have been frustrated with this set in my classroom as the skill set for words isn't quite right. Probably the best use in the classroom would be to set the letters (lowercase and uppercase) with the matching word images (ie, image of dog) on top of cupcake for beginning letter recognition.

title: Cute outfit...glitter wearing off
text: We love these 14inch doll clothes for the price. Currently Elsa is wearing these clothes and they fit her so they work for more than just the Glitter Girl Dolls. I did take a star off due to the fact the they arrived with the glitter already wearing off the shoes. So the glitter doesn't seem to be lasting on this one. Other than that though cute outfit for dollies!

title: Great for the Lego Lover!
text: Great set for the Mine craft lover or really any LEGO fanatic! The kids loved playing with these and imagining their own scenes with them. Another quality Lego Set! These legos are so awesome! My kids have played with them non stop- the step by step instructions make it easy to build the Minecraft scene- and they love being creative and making their own!!!

title: Great quality and fit on many things
text: We love these glitter girls our fits in this house! My 4 year old put them on her Wellie Wisher Doll and some other 14 inch dolls we have. They are also great for putting on stuffed animals! This outfit fits beanie babies well!

title: Easier to open....easier to crack
text: A popular kid favorite right now are Hatchimals and this is very similar to the other Hatchimals I have purchased for my daughter. These ones were easier for her to crack though...which had its goods and bads. Good because she didn't need my assistance in opening them and felt more independent. The bad is one of the eggs cracked in transit. Like the top had come off. Leaving one surprise not as much of a surprise. Which let's face it the opening and the surprise is one of the kids favorites things. The character that came out were cute and came with cute little accessories. My daughter has enjoyed playing with them.

title: Not as nice as other Chase cruisers we have but still works
text: My daughter who is 4 is a big Paw Patrol fan. So she obviously likes this toy. We have other chase toys and this one seems quite a bit cheaper than the others we have. One bummer is that chase's legs don't bend so there is no sitting him down. He only stands. The toy is fine for a little guy and they will like it there are just better chase cars and chases out there.

title: Works well, quality pieces, kids liked it
text: Really cute toy! Would be perfect for someone who likes trucks or tractors. My daughter's were somewhat interested in it. My 15 month old was a bit unsure what to do with it just yet. But in another couple months I could see it clicking more for her. My 4 year old enjoyed it more. She likes the big “claw”. Also the different “rocks to put in and out were a nice touch. The noises on it are not overwhelming so from a parent perspective I like this toy as it didn't annoy me. All in all a. Great quality toy. That seems like it will last through the many drops a toddler might put it through.

title: Durable and darling
text: I am really impressed with this set! It is durable and darling!!! My daughter and her friends love “cleaning” the house with this set. At first I thought the funny little music that played was kind of lame, but my daughter loves that silly button she can push while she does her “work” and jives as she “cleans”. Perfect for imaginative play!! And durable!!!!  held up to my wild nephew who came over this week and was banging the sweepers and mop all over the place.

title: A favorite “toy” in our house!
text: Probably one of the top 10 things I've gotten on Amazon for my kids! I have a 4 year old and a 1 year old and they both LOVE these. I really questioned if these would be a hit, but boy was I wrong to question! These are literally played with everyday as they stack them, roll on them, climb, or whatever their imaginations come up with! Highly recommend! They are excellent quality and seem like they will hold up!

title: 4 year olds LOVED it!
text: This is adorable! My daughter and her cousins have spent this week playing with it and they have loved it! Their age range is 4-5. They did need some extra help in understanding what to do at first. So if they are preschool age that is something to keep in mind. I love how it comes with different ideas to do with it. But it is also great just for imaginative play!

title: Great for an Octonaut Reporter!
text: My daughter LOVES Octonauts!!! So this was a win for her! She was very excited about it. She enjoyed launching the character off down the wooden floor in our hallway. A couple drawbacks is you will need hard floor for these things to move well. She also lost interest in it in not very much time. But overall a nice toy for the Octonaut Lover!

title: Quality and cute!
text: Absolutely darling! My daughter LOVES frozen and she loves this set. About a year ago I kept looking for Little People that were from the Frozen movie I am glad they have finally come out with some! My daughter loves taking the characters in and out of the sled. Most other Little People fit in the sleigh as well especially if they are from the Disney Princess line. The light is also a nice extra touch. The sleigh has a little “bounce” to it as you push it along. Super cute!

title: Incredible quality. Life like details
text: I have been really impressed with the quality of these toys. My daughter has been really into ocean animals lately so these are right up her ally. She enjoyed creating ocean scenes with them. She also uses them in her kid pool outside since it is summer.

title: Basic play sword
text: This is a nice play sword. My daughter enjoyed playing with it. It is very basic no special effects. I would say it is worth under $10. It does seem durable. My daughter has hit it against things and it's still in one piece. Great for imaginative play.

title: Daughter loves it doesn't stay on the greatest.
text: My daughter loves Paw Partrol and this watch is right up her ally! She loves playing with it and pushing all the buttons. The only down side to this watch is it doesn't seem to stay on very well. It snaps in but seems to often come unsnapped so I'm having to help her get it back on often.

title: Cute and creative!
text:
My daughter, who is 4, loved this set! She enjoyed painting them and decorating the different parts and pieces. As she is 4 I did have to help her and stay somewhat near to avoid too much of a mess. This was a great value as everything you need is there.

This would also make a darling birthday gift for one of my daughter's friends. Something I will keep in mind for the future! So much better than just a toy!

title: Super cute and 4 year old loved it.
text: My 4 year old loves this craft set!! It made a darling cow and donkey. She had fun decorating them and playing with them after. It is minimal mess for me which is a major plus as the parent. I highly recommend this craft kit for any preschooler. Great thing for a rainy day inside.

title: Works on other dolls
text: My daughter uses this for her Wellie Wisher Doll. It fits her doll well and at 4 was able to pull it on the doll herself without adult assistance. The golf ball is very small so I won't be surprised if it gets lost eventually. So that piece is very tiny. Cute set though! She especially likes the flamingos on the shirt.

title: More like 5+ my 4 year old wasn't a fan
text: We have had other Glitter Girl products my 4 year old has loved, but this one did not work for us. It did not keep her attention at all. She just got frustrated that she couldn't get the ball through the cupcake. It is visually appealing and probably her favorite part was the ice cream cones she could "feed" her doll. Maybe if my daughter was a golf fan it would be a hit? Or if she was a little older and her dexterity was more developed.

title: No mess fun
text: The advantage of this activity is this is crafty without the mess. My daughter enjoyed making her sweet treats and then playing pretend tea party with them! She is 4 years old. The only draw back would be there is pretty limited personal creation and room for imagination with the creative process of making the sweets. It's is literally shake and stick on stickers. But a great simple craft that is good for a rainy day at home as clean up is minimal.

title: Baby likes watching it pop!
text: Baby girl is 1 and enjoys watching the balls pop when I push it. She likes rolling it along the floor at this stage, but has not yet mastered pushing it down on her own. I'd say closer to 15 months before I expect her to push it down on her own. The product is made of quality materials and is durable as I've watched it roll along on hard floors.

title: Just okay...toddler needed assistance
text: My 4 year old needed help cutting with some of these scissors. She did okay with the straight cutter on her own but struggled with the other two. They don't make the neatest cut as I've found most safety scissors don't. They will be good for her to practice with without me having to worry about her cutting herself but they don't have the highest quality or best cut

title: Quality and entertaining for many ages!
text:
This is a darling puzzle/carousel pulling toy! Both my 1 year old and 4 year old love it! My youngest enjoys taking it apart and pulling it along and watching it spin. My oldest enjoys piecing it back together again. The quality of this item is wonderful! It is a classic toy which is one I will want to keep for grandkids someday. I also like how there are bits of rubber on the wheels to keep it from scratching my wood floors.
This item would also make a darling gift!

title: Engaging toy for a child
text: My daughter adores this set! We got it for her to use with her Wellie Wisher Doll. Probably the only con is that there are a lot of tiny pieces so cleaning up after taking a bit. This toy encourages imaginative and creative play for my daughter. She will play with it for a long time. Simulating picnics and more. The cash register is darling too! It pops out and little coins are inside! Well worth purchasing!

title: Cute little “pet” like toy
text: [[VIDEOID:2441cc98b3e3078c11c41659f34a60e9]] Makes good little purr sounds for your child to enjoy a “pet” like toy. My daughter enjoys playing with it and the light up mane is a nice extra feature. The noises it makes are not to loud so it is not overly annoying to adults that have to hear it throughout the day.  The fingerling having a baby is also fun for my daughter as it gives her more to do with imaginative play for the toy.

title: Adorable!
text: This is such a cute craft set! My 4 year old daughter loved it! It is also cute and it great for storing her costume jewelry. It seems sturdy too like it will last!

title: Not great..
text: The idea of this game is really cute but it just did not work that great. It only took a couple pieces of “treasure” to come out for the bottom to pop up causing the fish to inflate. So the game is short lived. The fish also did not inflate as well as the product image show.

title: Darling doll outfit
text: This outfit is darling. I got it for my daughter for her Wellie Wisher Doll and it fits her doll perfectly! She loves it! It seems to be made of nice quality. And I love that it came with a cute bow for the doll too!

title: Great concept...but “pond” a little too small
text:
First, your child may be terrified of this game. My 4 year old ran screaming from the rolling croc! 🤣😂. So make sure your child is one that would like this kind of game.
Now onto the actual game... I felt the pond thing they make is not quite big enough. It works for very small kids. But really a little bigger would be better. Ours did not get stuck on the edges like some said but the play area was just too small.

title: Cute Instrument set for your little!
text:
My 1 year old really liked these little instruments. They are made of high quality materials. My 4 year old had little interest in them. So I feel like these are more suited for 1-3.
Pros:
-unique eye catching shapes and designs
-beautiful high quality
-many different options
-not too loud so doesn't get on my nerves

Cons:
-The hippo is adorable but doesn't as easily clap to make its noise.

title: Another darling Melissa and Doug Product
text:
These are cute grasping toys for my 1 year old. The lion and giraffe are probably her favorites. The lion's mane clicks as you turn it which is captivating for the little one. She enjoys bending the giraffe. The zebra is still fun for her as the center section moves but she seems more interested in the other two. I also like that you get three different options in one box.
These are classic beautifully painted toys.

title: Darling set!
text: The usual darling Melissa and Doug quality strikes again in this cute set. My daughter (4 years old) is dog and cat obsessed and loves this set. A major pro for parents about this set is the whistle does not blow loud! So that is a major win for my ears. I like how this is a great toy for imaginative play for her. She enjoys taking her other stuffed animals to do tricks on the set as well. I did sit with her when she first opened it and we talked about the different tricks “dogs” can do with the set. I suggest doing that so your child knows what to do when they play.

title: Great concept
text:
The concept of this so cute. But as far as putting this together I would say this is better suited for 5+. My daughter who is 4 got frustrated with it as the glue isn't all that strong so you have to hold it for a LONG time to get it to stay. I ended up using my own glue to put it together since it wasn't staying together with the glue provided. Once we put it together my daughter loved it though and has loved playing with it after the creation part. The story provided in the directions booklet is really cute! And my daughter and I loved reading it together.
Know that if you are doing this with a 4 year old the adult will be basically putting most of it together.

title: Great for preK- kindergarten
text:
Cute product. I like how my daughter sounded out the letters as she did them. She isn't reading yet but is recognizing letters. So this is great letter practice for her. I did take a star off as this is a new item and a couple of the letters are already starting to wear off (notice image with letter K). So the quality overall is good except for the printing of the letters.
As far as your child doing this independently... my daughter who is almost 4 needed assistance. I would say by 4.5-5 this could be done independently.

title: Super cute and nice quality!
text: My daughter is a big frozen set and has loved these puzzles! I especially liked how the pieces both had polka dot print on the back on the one and the other puzzle was solid blue so we could tell which pieces went with which puzzle! My almost 4 year old has put these together again and again!

title: Makes great sound effects
text: My daughter LOVES this! She has lots of the Mickey Racer cars and loves "filling" them up. Makes great sound effects! Highly recommend for any Mickey Fan!

title: Five Stars
text: Perfect toy for your toddler/preschooler!!! They will love it. My daughter will do her button "art" forever!

title: She loved them!
text: Got these for a teacher friend. She loved them!

title: Five Stars
text: Classic game that every family should have in  their house.

title: Great first blocks for your daughter
text: Great first blocks for your daughter! Got them for my daughter around 18 months she still loves them, but now prefers slightly more complicated blocks.

title: My 2 year old loved these. Got them for her birthday
text: My 2 year old loved these. Got them for her birthday. Made of sturdy cardboard so you don't have to worry about them ripping. Great first puzzle for your little, or memory game.

title: Came off easily using a baby wipe
text: Truly are washable! Came off easily using a baby wipe!!! Perfect for my preschoolers!

title: Great for you young toddlers.
text: I seriously love these!!! We have used just about ever Alex Tots products. We often purchase the sticker themed dollar store version of these. These Alex ones are so much nicer and bigger! The stickers are nice quality. My daughter is two. Some stickers are trickier to get off and I have to assist. For the most part though she can do it all herself! Which she loves, and mom!

title: Work great! But...
text: These work great. I got them for my almost 2 year old. They were not dried out and they all work. Trust me my daughter tried every single one.  The only bummer was they were not like the ones pictured with just the heads of animals. The animals that came were the whole body.  Which made them a little harder to see. Plus I was hoping to get the giraffe (like the one pictured) as my daughter is obsessed with them.
My daughter loves this little garden. We got it for her 1st birthday and still plays with it at 21 months! Totally worth the purchase ❤️

title: Great for outside play
text: My daughter and I have enjoyed playing with these on sunny days in our driveway! Love how it has so many different shades of colors!!!

title: So cute!
text: This is a perfect tea set for the bath. The cup and tea pot have multiple different holes in them for water to pour our for fun play for my little girl. My daughter is currently 20 months and enjoys it!

title: Perfect!
text: This was so great for our trip to Hawaii with my 1 year old daughter. She was in it both with and with out the cover. She loved cruising the pool in it! Held her really well, she is about 21 pounds.

title: Love it!
text: Fantastic puzzle. The one I got was EXCELLENT quality. High recommend for any 1-2 yr old to have jumbo knob puzzles. They love them!

title: Cute
text: Super cute plastic puzzle. I bought this thinking it would be like the laugh and learn farm one my daughter has. She loves that one as each puzzle piece makes a sound as you put it in. This one the pieces do not make sound when you put them in, it only makes sound when you push the yellow round button. She likes to play with it she just likes the farm one more. So if you are wanting one that each piece makes a sound buy the "Laugh and Learn" fisher price line of puzzles not the "Silly Sounds" line. Still cute through and still does keep her entertained.

title: Perfect for your little!
text: We actually bought a slightly different color scheme, but my baby LOVES this elephant shape sorter! She loves to stick her hand in the trunk and take out the shaped. She also enjoys the clicking sound it makes when you spin it.

title: Super Cute!
text: I have wooden puzzles for my daughter from a few different makers, but Melissa and Doug has the highest quality! This one really is darling. They are a little cheaper at Marshalls. That's where I like to buy mine (including where I got this one).

title: Remote awesome! Phone not so much.
text: The remote is great! Works really well, but the phone is a dud. Not sure if I just got a lemon or what but no matter if you put new batteries in or not you can hardly hear the sound. These didn't come in normal packaging like from the store, so straight from a factory?

title: Baby loves it!
text: One of my favorite purchases for my little! We got it for her around 6 months and is still one of her go to toys at 12 months!

title: A baby favorite!
text: My baby girl loves these soft critters. She isn't to the sorting stage yet but at 7 months loves to grab and chew on them. Her favorites are the grasshopper and the spider as they have legs that are great for her teething mouth :).

title: Nephew loved it!
text: Got this as a Christmas gift for my 12 month nephew. He loved it! Winning!

title: Great for adults!!!!
text: I create curriculum for k-3 so I'm always coloring making samples. These are seriously a life safer as they don't break from my adult hands holding them when I try to color.

title: Great for babies!
text: Okay I know the toy says 3+ but in my opinion a 3 year old should be on a real piano or keyboard by that point discovering that. This is great for toddlers and babies to introduce them. Keep in mind though when I say that I don't mean you can set it in the middle of the room and they will just know what to do, you need to encourage them in discovery! I sit with my 6 mo old at the piano as she happily pounds and feels the piano for up to 30 mins.

title: Great purchase!
text: My 6 month old LOVES this toy! She loves the lights and music! Worth the purchase!

title: Great
text: Perfect for that 6 mo stage. I gave this to my daughter around 5 months, but she still likes it. She loves grabbing at the knob. I can tell she will love it even more in about a month when her grabbing has gotten better :).

title: Great Product!
text: I bought this for my nephew for his first birthday. He absolutely LOVED it! Perfect for the stage he is in right now!

title: Great
text: 2 months later and they are still inflated! Vibrant color

title: Nice gift
text: Very nice matching game and durable material

title: Cute
text: I liked that even though it was multi player game it wasn't too long of a game and everyone was always actively playing. Also the pieces are very durable. Very small pieces be careful!

title: Great buy!
text: we Needed something to entice my Daughter to showers rather than baths and this did the trick! It's so easy to teach her her letters now!

title: Great buy!
text: My daughter loves her Elena Dress. It's great for the small price!

title: Good design but smells AWFUL!!!!!!!
text: Good design.  Wood could be higher quality.  Smells awful!

title: This was a gift
text: This was a gift sent to my grandsons, I don't know if they have even played it yet.

title: This was a gift
text: Grandsons played them at Christmas.

title: This was a gift
text: Grandsons played them at Christmas.

title: The kids loved them
text: Big hit with my niece and nephew.

text: Ordered as a gift, but they like Jenga so we'll see how they like this

title: Ordered as a gift
text: Ordered as a gift - we'll see how they like it

title: Love dice games
text: We love Yahtzee and this appears similar.  Ordered as a gift so don't know yet if it is a hit or not.

title: Beyond the cube
text: My oldest grandson loves the rubik cube.  Thought he might like this as well.

title: Grandkids love animals
text: Ordered as a gift.  My grandkids love animals, so hopefully they will like this game.

title: Family tradition game
text: Had this game when my kids were little, bought it for my daughter's kids.

title: Great attention holder.
text: I ordered this as a gift for my grandson with ADHD.  He loved the fidget spinner I got for him last year, so I figure he will have just as much fun with this cube.

title: Fun. I would recommend
text: We are having fun with the sprinkler. It has been a fun relief from the heat. It seems to work well and seems to be durable. I have a 9, 7, 5 year old kidos, and they are enjoying it. It is also so much easier to put out than the slip and slide even though we use it, too.

title: Love this car
text: Love this car. It is easy to operate. It is a good start to learning how to use remote control cars. My 4 and 5 year olds love it.

title: IT'S TRUE!!!!!!
text:
Okay, so it's true. I didn't understand it before, but this board will basically begin changing (vortexing?) if left out overnight. I don't understand if it's due to it collecting moisture since it's been stored away in a vacuum sealed container until we opened it... but be careful. Highly recommend to try not to leave it out too long or else the sides will literally curve upwards.
My boyfriend and I fixed this issue by using binding clips and our lamp to help flatten it out.
Otherwise, the game is super fun and high-quality pieces and cards too. Definitely would recommend for Monopoly lovers out there.

title: Still fun, but not the quality it used to be
text: I am trying to get my kids more toys like the ones I grew up with (70's/80's), and get them away from so much tech! They have liked them, and this one is no exception. It comes with several different cards for several games. I wish it had 2 buttons on the front. The kids and adults sat around at Christmas and someone always seemed to be playing on it. The only other issue was that to get the balls out of the pockets for a new game, you have to turn it upside down, and this means the plug at the top is useless unless you hold it down. Just don't flip it over anything you don't want water dripping on. Otherwise, it is fun to share these "old fashioned" games with my children and see them play.

title: Five Stars
text: It is SO cute and perfect for our function but came too late for us to use.

title: Decwnt quality, good value
text: Much better than Dollar Tree types, used these for an 8th Bday party at school and all the students and teachers loved them.

title: Good for play, almost too small for campouts
text: Very easy to set up and take down but definitely not as spacious as it appears. My 4 year old's sleeping bag fits perfectly but my 6 years old's is almost too long once the pillow is added, with her feet almost sticking out. It's perfect for indoor play but for campouts, it's just medicore for the two of them at the same time. There are no zippered closures, only velcro, so I wouldn't use this outside due to bugs and weather.

title: Good
text: Good adhesive but they shed easily, especially if trimmed to fit smaller children. Overall, my little Luigi enjoyed his Halloween 'staches.

title: For a Pokémon and Lego fanatic
text: Came in great condition. Gave this as a gift and it was greatly loved. However, a child may need some assistance to locate pieces to put it together. Great way to pass time and build things together. The little Pokémon figures once completed are very cute.

title: It's okay..
text: The suncatchers were cute. Though it is a great way to pass time or activity final outcome was a little disappointing. The activity us fun yes and the kids loved it, they shortly got upset. When using the suction cups to put up on windows or mirror it didn't last long. They fell not long after. Additionally, as it fell the paint that dried fell off from the suncatchers. So it looked as if they didn't color it in again. To touch up and fix we used window markers to color them back in. Didn't want to use the paint provided again afraid that it might fall off again.

title: Great way to pass time
text: Took a while to assemble, but still came out great~ It also comes with a bag to carry the car and remote control easily. If you follow the manual, it's not too hard to assemble. It also comes with extra pieces just in case you loose one or two. Recommend if you like assembling things and want something to pass the time.

title: Lovely robot
text: 😍🥰🥰 cutest coin collecting robot. I enjoy watching him to move around and introduce himself. And it make clicking sound when I drop coins into it.

title: triangle rubick cube
text: i love rubick cube and have some collection of it and just did not find any triangle one. There it has it so smooth moving and solving guide is so helpful too. Thank you so much

title: Didn't last long....
text: He's cute, but after just 9 or 10 times playing with him....he sprang a leak from underneath a clear sticker with print on it that's underneath it and towards the tentacles. Waste of money.

title: Excellent for physical therapy
text: Physical Therapist recommended I use this, works great

title: Four Stars
text: bought for grandson, loves it

title: Hit the spot
text: Just what Amazon ordered.

title: Will grab everyone's eyes at the table.
text:
Light weight, beautiful coloring, and they grab the attention of everyone when you throw them.
The ones I received came as pictured and are shinny and draw your attention.

The only things I could find wrong were that the d4 had on one of it's edges a tiny bump in the metal that looked like a bead of running paint.
And on one of the die the swirl patter is diffrent than the rest. But you have to really look at them to notice these defects. But they don't bother me at all.

They roll nicely, and do sound a bit like wind chimes when rolled together.
So far they haven't bent or deformed, even when dropped onto stone flooring from above table heights.
I also haven't noticed a favored side on any of the dice due to being heavier on any side.

Over all I would say a good buy. They are pretty expensive but they are also hollow metal and dipped for their color. Your buying them as an attention grabber and they do that better than many painted or carved dice I have seen.

title: So worth it.
text: Had all the parts, came a day early. Best when bought with other large sets or to add to existing parts but way cheaper than buying outa a store.

title: Worth it.
text: Had every piece.  Was as advertised. Came a day early in the mail. Kids loved it and really helped them make bigger creations.  Works best when bought with other large packs or as an addition to existing sets.

title: PLACE IT ON THE OTTOMAN!  Solid construction!!
text: The most challenging thing about working with puzzles......  is where to place the puzzle and/or puzzle board.  I have a larger home,  but sometimes even I get crowded trying to place a puzzleboard.  So,  while I watch TV,  I have a lengthier cushioned ottoman.  It is perfect for laying this on top of ottoman.  You can still spin comfortably.......  best feature.  The material is felt and the wood trim is solid.  It is heavy, solid,  and attractive.  Of the puzzle boards I have worked with,  I like this one!

title: Quality puzzle,  nice one for the cat lovers!
text:
This is a puzzle that I am working on. I am separating the pieces, and with many many little different images of cats, it makes it more challenging to put together. I start with images for the LEFT and images that belong on the RIGHT. Then, I work at the pieces from Left and organize, and after that, I work on the Right.

What is good is that the puzzle pieces are good quality. Good quality puzzles hold together when you need to lift a set of pieces. And, they have a pattern on the backside. I love that because it identifies the pieces to the exact puzzle. You can't go wrong by mixing it with another puzzle. Nice images of cats, nice quality puzzle!

title: The board is not level.
text:
If you place this on a table, you will see that the board is not level. That defect makes it awkward to lay flat and feel comfortable about it. The board is large and has two heavy clamps to hold the felt. Felt is good to hold the puzzle. With the side sorters that are on the size, it is not easy to access pull out easily. The sorters are spacious. But, be careful how you lay this board, as you don't want to block the sorters from sliding out.

Included with the board is the felt, and the bag that can hold a rolled up puzzle. I don't generally do a roll up. So, if yours is in perfect shape, it may work out good. The board is basically pine which is not treated/painted.

For the money, not great!

title: This is exactly what I need!
text:
Over the past many years, I have been struggling to keep puzzles separate, and I have used various contraptions to do so. I can't believe these gadgets are available. This has to be the best way to control the separation of pieces. Yes, you can put certain colors in the blue or white. Sometimes, what I do, is separate top from bottom, or left from right if you don't have color identification.....like many puzzles.

The trays stack up and fit well. Then, you can place the entire thing away. It certainly will not take up much room at all. Yes, pack it up neatly, put a lid on it and store it. This is a great gadget. Love it.

title: Handy!  Very handy!
text:
I have tried through the years of sorting my puzzles. I have used different contraptions, varying degrees of homemade sorters. But this one is perfect! I like the stackable concept. Keeps my puzzle sorting compact. I like the stacking concept because it keeps the sorter from losing your pieces. You can pack up the entire sorter and put it away...... easily, out of the way, takes little space!

Excellent. I need another puzzle sorter. This one has enough sorter trays, and some trays, I have noticed have less trays. Great product. It is handy!

title: Can't go wrong with Lego!
text:
There are a lot of little pieces here, and the problem with children is they need a space to lay this out and keep from losing pieces. The pieces are colorful and solid. A couple of 7 year old were working on it and they had fun!

Good quality product, fun for children, keeps them busy for hours! LEGO, you can't go wrong with this quality brand!

title: A toy full of action!
text:
This is a great toy for those children who need a dash of stimulation. It is large, colorful, loud, and mostly, shooting the nerf darts is always fun for kids. The projection is good. This young relative had a blast with this. He liked the nerf darts, and the sound of continuous action while in use. Again, It is a large in length toy, but the kind of toy that kids don't give up easily. Kids will always find some targets. And this 7 year old nephew is always looking for action and shooting the nerf darts!

Good Toy Blaster! Quality and colorful, loud and lights!!

title: Strangest puzzle of PIECES NOT FITTING!
text: i have never had a puzzle that I believed to be defective.  At the bottom,  there are pieces that FIT,  and when you add another piece to that side,  it does not fit either.  Several pieces at the bottom just will not work.  The pieces MATCH exactly,  but something is going on that makes another close to it not fit.  Strange,  never had it like this before.  I call it a defective puzzle that I got!

title: Inspiring game of thinking and reacting.
text: Kids need more thinking games, instead of computer games that don't inspire the mind.  The quality is good,  the game is simple to learn, and all about memory and matching.  Grandkids like the game,  learned quickly, and had fun.  The quality of the game is good too.  It can be a lasting game if handled with care.

title: Nice construction,  challenging puzzle!
text:
Springbok is a well-known name for puzzles, and I have done many! I always prefer 1,000 pieces with some level of challenge. But this is difficult, merely because of the similar colors. Building scenes are not my choices and it does take me a while. I like the different puzzle cuts here. I think it makes it a tad easier than some with identical cuts.

The board of the puzzles is good, strong! Colors are attractive. And, as I said, this is a challenging puzzle, as many building and/or scenery images can be. But, yes, Springbok makes good quality puzzles. I enjoy working on them and this one is taking me a while. Some people do puzzles quickly, but it can take me months as I work few hours a day. Good puzzle!

title: Good and Sharp enough for Kids
text:
Apparently these scissors are advertised as for kids. If so, then they have the sharpness that is suitable for children. I am using these to cut small sheets of paper, and although they are not the best in sharpness, they are good for small jobs. With these scissors, being not as sharp is safer for kids.

If you cut paper, you get the cut. Not 100% smooth, but good enough for the price and children's hands!

title: CHECKER!  A NEW ANGLE -  BOW WOW WOW!
text:
i cannot imagine anybody not knowing or ever playing the classic board game Checkers. But this one has a new angle of approach. First of all, it is a Dog Lovers Edition..... who doesn't like dogs to play with you?

The board is standard size, foldable to fit into the box, and the quality is here, nice, colorful and sturdy. The checkers are in the shape of a dog bowl and when crowning a piece, the small, thin foam-like bone is used. These little doggie bowls are made with good quality plastic also.

You have the die contained in a plastic compartment and when you press, it pops. Read the instructions, because this is when the new angle lies to checkers.

You can store the entire game into the box and plastic holder. This is a new twist, fun and I give it a BOW WOW WOW!

title: A fun puzzle to put together!  Nice with many tiny images of people and the marketplace.
text:
What makes this puzzle interesting, is the hundreds of different images that specifically includes marketplace items. The puzzle features several sections that can be divided. That's how I separate the puzzles, by these sections: the sky, window on left, window on right, stone walk, marketplace center, vegetables, and the toys.

With these many items, it makes for interesting searches. And, the puzzle is a "Can You Find Puzzle", naming various items for searching.

The construction of the cardboard is not the best, being that the cardboard pieces are thick, thus more prone to have layers come loose. But it works out great. Many pieces are same shape, making it more of a challenge. And, I enjoyed this one, due to the many colorful images.......Rizzo

title: The Challenge is working with the small pieces that don't interlock too good.
text:
If you have ever done a Norman Rockwell Collage puzzles, they can be challenging, merely because the pieces are all the same cuts. This isn't a puzzle with odd shapes, it is all the same small sizes.

Different cut of board? Normally, when I do these Mega Puzzles, Rockwell, the pieces are good, interlock and handle well. This particular puzzle did not interlock well. This makes it difficult to work with, as the pieces fall off if you try to move them. And if you attempt to slide a set of puzzle pieces that have been hooked together, they don't hold well either.

I decided to start at the edges, completely all around. So, looking at the image on the box, there are two.... the large picture on the front does not display the entire puzzle. You have to look at the sides for the rest of the puzzle, which is smaller.

However, the smaller image in the back consists of the entire puzzles. Norman Rockwell collage puzzles are challenging, but fun at the same time.

The entire layout of this 1,000 piece puzzle is quite smaller than some I have worked on.

But, I have worked Norman Rockwell Collage Puzzles before, and I am quite sure the same company, but never have I had a puzzle that was difficult to work with. .....Rizzo

title: A nice change of pace.....nothing computerized, no little screen to touch and stare at!
text:
This is a nice, clean, family game to play. I think people and especially families need to get back into games that are not computerized. It takes a little skill, but, basically, it is a table top ball game. The skill comes in landing the lightweight balls into the hole.

It is simple, as each play picks a card that indicates what the challenge is. Each card demonstrates a row of balls, different configurations...thus, the player is to land his lightweight balls into that configuration. It is a game of matching the configuration per the display on the card.

Fun for family, kids, friends, and simple time-passing game. It's fun, and nothing computerized!! This is a real live game, try it. .....Rizzo

title: Memorable images of the past, excellent puzzle construction
text:
Most people do not realize that Normal Rockell's images for the Saturday Evening Post dated back to 1916. However, it is those from the 50's that are most well known. Rockwell had a way with the faces. Supposedly, he wanted to see America in this way.

The puzzle pieces are basically same size uniformity, thus making it a challenge to work with. But the puzzle pieces fit well, interlock tight, and are made of good material. With all these different images, it makes it more challenging to work with, because you can have too many start ups all over.

The classic images are here: The Gossips 1948; The Examination 1956; The Tattooist 1944; Daydreamer 1924; The Outing 1947; Dewey vs Truman 1948. There are some from The Sporting Life which include: 100th Yr. of Baseball 1939; Game Called Because of Rain 1949; The Dugout 1948.

This is a memorable and quite enjoyable puzzle to work on......Rizzo

title: Pieces are not all "interlocking", making it not stable or solid
text:
The concept of this puzzle is entertaining, utilizing some of Hollywood's most recognizable movie characters for a huge collage.

However, there are many pieces that are simply not interlocking, and they just sit next to one another. This makes it challenging, because the pieces tend to slide around when working around them.

There are a few pieces are are disproportionally drawn, such as the hands of certain characters.

The puzzle is rather simple, however, being that so many pieces are fleshtone, or similar for clothing, makes is difficult.

Again, all the pieces are not interlocking, making it more of a challenge to work on.....Rizzo

title: High quality substance!
text:
I have been working on Ravensburger puzzles for a long time, and then I move on to other ones when the going gets tough. Ravensburger puzzles are high quality, therefore if you want to seal the pieces and display the finished product, you can do so with Ravensburger Puzzle conserver.

The product is in a plastic bottle, creamy white color, and you can see where it is applied, how much and on what locations of the puzzle. Then, it dries clear. There is a foam applicator attached to the lid. The trick is to make sure you seal all the crevices within the puzzle pieces, otherwise you will have some pieces become loose. Do not apply too thick, spread it evenly. This strong adhesive will dry in good time, under an hour.

Some people may tend to use the conserver as they go along with the puzzle, but I would rather not. This is a quality Ravensburger product.. Rizzo

title: Interesting images, fun to work with, and challenging!
text:
Most people do not realize that the covers by Rockwell for the Saturday Evening Post date as far back as 1916. For some reason those images are not near as popular as the 50's images.

One of the most famous artist of our time was Norman Rockwell (1894-1978). His American images were everywhere, and loved by millions. Few are etched into the mind permanently. The pictures were sweet, charming, typical American business, family, with pure and innocent small town themes. Rockwell decided that the world was not a perfect place, and he chose to paint the ideal aspects of the world.

He was commissioned to paint for the Saturday Evening Post, 321 covers. It appears as if this image was perhaps painted as a collage of summer theme images in America.

The puzzle is 1,000 pieces, the pieces are solid, good material and they interlock well. There were some challenges here, but all in all, it was not that difficult. When puzzles have numerous images, it makes it easier to separate, but yet too many images also makes it challenging to find out where you want to start, and how much can you work on while you lay this out

There are more difficult sections to work on, and with so many different sections, it makes it more challenging to spread out ....Rizzo

title: Beautiful design, sturdy puzzles, huge layout!
text:
I generally keep a few puzzles goin on at the same time, working them in sections until I find it ready to move to a location. The size of this puzzles lays out at 38.5" x 29.5", and it will fill your dining table.

It will take me a significant amount of time to finish, because some puzzles are quite challenging, especially Ravensburger. These German made puzzles are detailed, nice colorful pictures, and the puzzles are well-constructed. They are easy to handle and the cardboard is good quality.

What is difficult here is the amount of ocean blue, which covers the upper half of the puzzles. There are beautiful colors here of the fish, and with the multitude of colors, it is difficult to place the pieces.

Again, Ravensburger puzzles are made well, beautiful designs resulting in attractive high-quality finished products ready for securing them.

If you do use puzzle glue for the final product, try the [[ASIN:B0000AP6LD Puzzle Conserver]], a permanant solution for your prized puzzles. ....Rizzo

title: KNOCK YOURSELF OUT!!
text:
One of the most successful high quality jigsaw puzzles originates from Germany. The Ravensburger puzzles are challenging, well made, fit well, and are huge. The Ravensburger puzzles range from 24 floor pieces to 5000+ pieces. These interlocking pieces are called "Soft-Click Technology", when correct pieces are interlocked and you can hear a soft click as they snap into place.

This Waterfall project is for the very experienced puzzle lover who is able to focus, with no ultimate frustration that allows many to quit. You need a large space to lay it out.
Mostly, this isn't for me. I like puzzles that are pleasing to the eye. This puzzle has basically, three colors, green, white, and aqua. There may be different shades of each, but that's it folks....three.

I want my puzzle to be something I can believe will be accomplished, something that doesn't get boring to work on. I can't see anybody faithfully dedicated, but I assume there are puzzles fanatics who can work on this and successfully complete it.... The puzzles generally range by difficulty, and this is it. Good Luck, NOT FOR ME! ....Rizzo

title: Clear the bed.... this one is huge!
text:
I have not had a 2,000 puzzle before, didn't realize Ravensburger made them. The Ravensburger product is made in Germany, and one of the finest puzzles you will work on. The pieces are cut well, no pieces are separating from the cardboard.

Working with puzzles is best when you have quality puzzles, where pieces fit nicely together, where the pieces can be held up and still together. You need to have nice sizes, with a good feel and a nice snap when you put them together. The pieces are non-glare. Coloring of the puzzles is high quality.

These are Ravensburger puzzles, nice attractive pictures, challenging puzzles if anything.

How to start??? This one is nearly 30" by 40". That's quite a large space, and you need to figure how you will work with this. With puzzles that take a large space, you need to be able to work around the puzzles for easy accessibility.

The puzzle here is a mixture of famous beach spots around the United States. With the pictures separated by locales, you may find it easier to separate, otherwise, these puzzles can be very challenging.

Will I ever finish a 2,000 piece puzzle? I doubt it.

There are several websites that feature info on the Ravensburger puzzles, in case you need to replace a piece, or warranty info. Search the web..... Enjoy! Rizzo.

title: Not Much Fun, I'm Afraid
text:
Other reviewers have already detailed the play of the game. We had this at our game night last Saturday. Participating were three adults and three teenage girls (seniors in high school). Kibitzing were two other adults and a 13-year-old boy.

Overall we thought the game was rather dull. The directions were complicated and we even missed the fact that when more than one person answered a category question correctly, they had to have a playoff for it. The trivia facts were interesting, but it just grew monotonous after a while, and that was odd, because this group is fond of both "Trivial Pursuit" and "Chronology." Interestingly, the teenage players got several questions correct because "We saw that on the Discovery Channel!" (So, rejoice folks, some kids ARE learning facts watching the right television stations!) The kibitzers admitted it wasn't much fun to watch.

We just played one game and then went on to something more fun (Yahtzee Free-For-All).

title: Yahtzee Fun-For-All
text: We bought this game knowing nothing about it other than it was a variation of Yahtzee. We put it away for a month or so and then pulled it out for a game night among a group of people age 16 through 55. Once we understood the instructions we just played it for the rest of the night. At least two of my friends noted down the game name to buy it for themselves, and the next time we had a game night (at another friend's home) I was requested quite strongly to "bring that new Yahtzee game, please!" Highly recommended!

title: We love this version!
text: It's still not a quick game. We take on average, 2-3 hours to play, but we like the new features. This has a special die that makes things fun in the beginning but then the advantage it affords you takes a turn to disadvantage after all properties have been bought or auctioned off. We also like the sky scraper options. Tips we've learned through play: it's not about Boardwalk and Park Place. Get those railroads and build depots. Get the utilities too…and have fun!!
